A good sleeper spends about a quarter of their sleep time in REM. So, if a person lives for 90 years, they will spend six or seven years dreaming in REM sleep.

When researchers take away REM sleep from people, they find that the next night, people have more REM sleep. This shows that dreams are important. In 1953, researchers found REM sleep, and many agreed with psychologist Sigmund Freud, who said that understanding dreams helps us understand our minds. But later studies showed that it is not that simple. Now, researchers focus more on the physical reasons for dreams rather than the psychological ones. 

Currently, there is not much agreement among dream researchers, according to Robert Stickgold from Harvard University. Dreams are important. At a meeting of sleep experts, P.F. Pagel from the University of Colorado found that actors, writers, and directors remember and use their dreams better than other people. He believes that creative people use their dreams more. This makes sense because films are very dream-like.

But I wonder, do only creative people need their dreams? Don’t teachers, software designers, and politicians also need to think creatively? Stickgold says that dreams help us connect ideas in new and surprising ways. They help us find new patterns and think differently. For example, when people are woken from REM sleep and asked to think of something related to a word, their ideas are more original than when they wake from other sleep stages. They think of unexpected connections. This is what creativity is.

I find that I write better after having intense dreams. Even a bad dream can help me think better. On those days, my ideas come out quickly, and I can hardly keep up with my typing. I don’t know how it works, but it does help. Creativity is not just for writers or artists. We all live in a complex world. We need our brains to work well. We need to think creatively and flexibly in our relationships with others. This is why dreaming is important.

Twenty years ago, Susie Ray left London to live in a small town by the sea in south-west England. When you enter her studio, you see a beautiful view of the sea and many empty frames on the walls, along with happy pictures of her two daughters. Susie is a talented copyist artist. She can copy famous paintings from the past very well. “I don’t keep my own paintings,” Susie says. “As soon as I finish them, I sell them.” 

Many people want her work. In her 30 years as a copyist, she has painted many famous artists like Renoir, Monet, and Van Gogh. Her copies are so good that experts sometimes think they are the real paintings. The real paintings can sell for millions of pounds, but her copies sell for a few hundred pounds to £12,000, depending on how much time she spends on them. 

Susie does not tell the names of her clients, but they include art galleries and private collectors. Some collectors love art, but others want to show off. One famous buyer likes to say he has a ‘Van Gogh’ painting, but it is really a ‘Susie Ray Van Gogh’. “Many famous people pretend my copies are real,” she says. “That’s their choice.” Some collectors keep the real painting in a bank and show Susie’s copy at home. 

Susie is honest about her work. When she copies a famous painting, she tries to make it look as real as possible. She believes that doing a bad job would be unfair to the original artist. However, she puts her name on the back of the canvas. It is illegal to sell a copy as the real painting, and even though some people make money this way, Susie does not want to do that. People who make fake art often get into trouble. 

Susie is not rich, and she has had hard times, but now she feels more secure. She does not want to risk her good name with collectors and artists. Before being a copyist, Susie worked as an illustrator at a botanical garden after finishing her art degree. She earned very little money, but it helped her learn important skills. She had to be very careful and get things right the first time. She is happy she found a job that pays better.

When young artists ask Susie for advice, she tells them to learn to draw well and to be accurate. She has studied a lot to do her work. She can draw plants and make copies of old paintings, but she now focuses on French impressionists like Manet, Cezanne, and Degas. 

Some people think modern art is easy, but Susie believes that impressionists worked hard and were very careful. This makes their art difficult to copy. People wonder why Susie does not create her own art. She says her work comes from many years of practice, and she earns a good living from it. She has tried to make her own art, like oil paintings of fishing nets, but they looked too much like photographs. 

Susie is a perfectionist, and she wants everything to be just right.

Ellen MacArthur loved the sea and wanted to be the fastest sailor. Since she was a child, sailing was her big passion. She felt very connected to her boat, Kingfisher, which she used to sail around the world. When she was on land, life felt boring. She wanted to be back on the ocean, facing challenges, even in dangerous places.

After she finished second in a big race called the Vendée Globe, she showed me her small boat. She lived in a tiny space for 94 days. She planned everything carefully, even how many paper towels she needed. She had special food, a small stove, and medical supplies. She took great care of her boat because it was her home and her life depended on it.

Now, Ellen sees the world like a boat that is beautiful but fragile. She had a big change in her thinking when she visited South Georgia, a lonely island. There, she helped with a study about albatross birds. This experience made her think about how we use resources. She saw old whaling stations and felt that people take what they want and leave.

When I visited Ellen at her office, she was finishing a call. She told me we need to act now to protect the planet. She said that coal, oil, and gas are limited resources. We need to find ways to use less. At first, she focused on using less, but now she talks about re-using things, like special carpet tiles.

For three years, she has been visiting factories and talking to people about our dependence on resources that cannot be replaced. She says she is not an expert, but she loves learning. She feels that sailing was selfish compared to her new mission. She started the Ellen MacArthur Foundation, a charity that helps young people think about a sustainable future.

Ellen misses the adventure of sailing. It is a big part of who she is. When she is at sea, she feels connected to everything and focused on survival. She believes her new message is important, even if it is not as simple as being the fastest sailor. She thinks this work is more meaningful than anything she has done before.

Jordan Romero is 13 years old. He wants to be the youngest person to climb Mount Everest. If he succeeds, he could be very famous. Jordan hopes to inspire other kids to go outside and climb their own mountains. His climbing team includes his father, Paul, and his mother, Karen. They call themselves "Team Romero." Climbing Everest is just one of their goals. If Jordan climbs Everest and Vinson Massif in Antarctica, he will be the youngest person to climb the Seven Summits, which are the highest mountains on each continent. Very few people do this before they are thirty years old. Jordan has already climbed five of them and might finish before he turns 20.

Many famous climbers think it is not a good idea for a 13-year-old to climb Everest. They believe that while Jordan may be strong, he might not be emotionally ready. They also think he may not have enough experience to make good decisions while climbing. The Romero family has heard these opinions before. Paul says, "I know people criticize us, but we have a lot to do. We think about the risks, but we believe our experience will help. Watching Jordan grow gives me confidence."

Paul also wants to make sure that Jordan really wants to do this. He says, "This project is not about me wanting to be famous. At first, Jordan thought he would do this later, but we decided, 'Why not now?' We talk to him often to see if he still wants to climb." When asked why he wants to climb, Jordan says, "I just focus on my goal."

In the past, not many people cared about being the youngest or fastest climber. Now, every adventure is shared online, and people want to break records. This makes it hard for Jordan. Some people think that trying to achieve records takes away the fun of climbing. But if Jordan wants to inspire others, he needs to share his journey online, take photos, and give interviews. He needs to do something amazing, like climbing Everest.

Paul adds, "If Jordan comes home tomorrow and says he wants to stop climbing and play basketball instead, we will stop this project and go to the gym."

When you see a teenager with an MP3 player, they are probably not listening to classical music. Many people can name many pop groups, but if you ask my friends about Brahms, they look confused. I just started studying music, but my classmates know as little about classical music as other teenagers. If you don’t know who wrote the music, you probably don’t have any of their recordings. This is sad for people who love classical music. Last year, only 3% of concert tickets sold were for classical music, and most classical recordings sell only 300 copies. This is hard to believe.

So, why are fewer people interested in classical music? Older people often blame our love for TV and video games, but I don’t think that is the reason. The truth is that classical music does not attract most people, especially teenagers, who buy the most music and concert tickets. I know some teenagers who go to classical concerts, but they are few. Even though I play in an orchestra, I don’t really like classical music. I enjoy many types of music, but I listen to classical music very little.

Why don’t teenagers like classical music? First, classical music has many changes in mood and rhythm, which can be hard for us. We like fast talking, fast playing, and fast thinking. Experts say we can only pay attention for about three minutes, which is too short for most classical pieces but just right for pop songs. Pop music is simple and easy to listen to, while classical music needs more time and focus. Also, pop music talks about things that interest teenagers, while classical music often does not have lyrics and can be long.

The way we listen to music has changed too. In the past, families would play music together at home, and playing an instrument was important. Now, we can find any music we want online, but we rarely hear classical music in our daily lives. When was the last time you heard classical music in a store? One of my teachers says that more people are going to classical concerts now. Maybe, but I don’t think many of them are teenagers. In my orchestra, we play classical music in many places, but when I look at the audience, I mostly see older people. I don’t know why more middle-aged people like classical concerts, but I do know that if your parents love something, you might want to avoid it.

Some people say schools are to blame for teenagers not liking classical music, but many kids want to play classical music in their school orchestras. They come early to practice and stay after school to rehearse. They enjoy classical music when they play it, but it is not their favorite music otherwise. The two activities have become separate. When we want to relax, we always choose pop music.

Bonnie Wyndham got out of her mother’s car and looked at Almonside School. “I will make you sorry I came here,” she said with a smile. Her mother was getting out of the car too, so she didn’t hear Bonnie, but Bonnie didn’t mind. Her mother knew how she felt. Mrs. Wyndham looked around. Almonside was a strange school with many buildings hidden in the trees on a hill. It looked confusing at first. Then she saw signs: Science block, gym, riding center… “Riding center,” Bonnie said, suddenly interested. “Headmaster’s study,” her mother said. “This way.” Bonnie followed her mother along a wide path between the trees. “I wish you would walk beside me instead of behind me like a dog,” Mrs. Wyndham said tiredly, but she didn’t expect Bonnie to do that.

A few minutes later, her mother was talking to Bonnie’s new headmaster in his office, while Bonnie waited outside the door. Suddenly, Bonnie stood up. “Why should I just sit here?” she said to herself. “I will be sent away soon anyway, so why not go now?” She left the building and went to the riding center, following the sign. There was a nice old building for the horses and a big place for indoor riding. Bonnie looked around, but there was no one there. She walked carefully to the horses, treating them with respect. The horses were well cared for, and she could see that right away. Almost every stall had a horse, and she looked at each one.

“I know what you are doing here,” she said to a small pony, touching its nose. Then she saw the next horse and stopped. “But aren’t you the best!” she said. He was brown with a little white. He looked lively, and Bonnie liked that. “I feel like we have met before,” she said, petting his neck. “In my dreams, I was riding you to win a big competition…” The horse’s name was Maverick. Suddenly, she wanted to ride him. “I wonder where I can find a bridle and a saddle,” she thought. The room with the riding gear was open, and Bonnie was happy to see that.

She was so focused on putting the saddle on Maverick that she forgot about her mother and the headmaster. When she sat on the big horse outside, she felt like a queen. Her old school nickname was Queen Bee, and she laughed as she remembered it. “You are the best horse I have ever ridden, Maverick,” she said. “I know about horses, even if I don’t know about anything else.” She nudged him to walk, then to trot. “If I stay here, I think we could be great friends,” she said. She rode around the paddock, feeling the wind on her face. She could tell Maverick trusted her, and she felt sure he would jump well.

I met Cody Simpson before, and I was impressed by his quiet confidence. Cody is a 15-year-old from Australia. He has already released many successful songs. How did this relaxed surfer become a star in front of many fans? 

Cody says, "I first picked up a guitar when I was six years old and started writing songs when I was seven." He loved swimming and surfing more than anything else at that time. When he was 13, he was in high school and posted some videos online. These videos changed everything. He started with a video of him and a friend singing at a school concert. Fans wanted to see more of his videos on social media. So, Cody recorded more videos at home, and the fans loved them.

Cody was also a great swimmer. He trained hard with good coaches. But then, record labels wanted him to sign a deal. He had to choose: stay in Australia and keep swimming or take a big risk and move to the US with his family. Cody decided to take the risk. 

He said, "It was very difficult for me to choose a career at such a young age. Can you imagine being 12 or 13 and trying to decide what you want to do for the rest of your life?" He had to tell his swimming coach and friends that he was moving to America. Most people were surprised because he is a quiet kid. He believes it is important to be modest in this crazy world.

Cody packed his bags and moved with his family to another country, giving up one dream to follow another. His family stays out of the spotlight but supports him. Cody thinks it is important to have good people around you to stay grounded.

Sometimes, he feels doubt. He thinks about how his decision affects his little brother and sister. His brother is eight years old and travels the world, doing school on the road. Cody worries about this sometimes, but his family always supports him.

Cody believes that success comes from being ready to say "yes" to big opportunities, even if it is scary. He says, "Everything happened so fast and unexpectedly. Now, I go to countries I never thought I would visit and play for many fans. It is a dream for many people, but I know it won’t last forever."

I jumped out of bed and looked out the window at the river. I saw a crack in the ice shining in the morning sun. I looked upstream at the sandbags that protect the buildings from flooding when the ice melts. My back hurt from lifting the sandbags last week. I worked hard with many people in the town to help. My grandfather did not notice my work.

I looked at the dark water from the factory. There was ice on both sides of the water. I took off my pajamas and put on my kayaking wetsuit. I saw a boy on the other side of the river. I did not know him. He was trying to balance on the ice near the warm water from the factory. I zipped up my wetsuit and checked my jacket pocket for my lucky silver chain. My grandfather gave it to me after his trip to South America. Only my mom, my grandfather, and I know about it. I also have his diary from that trip, and I read it before I sleep.

I went to the kitchen. “Good morning, Rex,” my mom said with a smile. “You are up early for a Saturday. I will make brunch after your training. Be careful.” “Thanks, Mom,” I replied. I walked down the hallway and almost bumped into my grandfather. “Watch where you’re going!” he shouted. “Where are you going?” “Sorry, Grandpa. I’m going kayaking.” He should have known that by my wetsuit.

Grandpa said, “What’s the point of training? You didn’t win the competition.” His words hurt, but I took a deep breath and counted to three. He went into the bathroom and slammed the door. My mom came to me with a kind smile. “Don’t mind him. He’s…” “...not himself right now,” I said. I wanted to say he always was like this, but I didn’t. I remembered when I was a child, he was my hero. He showed me pictures of his adventures in National Geographic magazine. Those pictures are still on his wall with his medals and trophies. But I don’t go into his room anymore. I have my own trophies now, and maybe one day, I will be in National Geographic too. Still, I want to care for him, even if he is grumpy.

My mom smiled. “At least he is coming out of his room more. Have a good training session, Rex. I admire your determination to keep going, even in the cold!” I smiled back and ate my banana. “It will be warmer in South America if I find sponsors for my trip,” I said. She laughed and went back to the kitchen. I finished my banana and went outside to the boathouse.

Mum grabbed Jess by the arm. "Come with me," she said. Jess followed her to the study. On the table, there was a painting by Grandpa. It was different from his other paintings and not finished. 

"Do you know anything about this?" Mum asked. Jess shook her head. "I’ve never seen it before. I didn’t know he was working on anything." 

Jess looked at the painting. It showed a river, but it was not a river she knew. It looked strange and beautiful. The riverbank was very small, with a little green. The water was pale and seemed to go to a hidden sea. There were no animals, birds, or people in the painting. It felt right that way. Jess thought about autumn coming after a long summer.

Mum spoke again. "It has a name." There was something in her voice that showed she was excited. Jess knew why. Grandpa never named his paintings. He just painted them and let others think about them. Mum turned the painting over and pointed to the words Grandpa had written. Jess read them: "River Boy." The words felt important to her, but she didn’t know why.

Then Jess looked at Mum. "There is no boy." 

"Exactly. It’s strange for him to be so specific. But maybe he will add the boy later. I made the mistake of asking him about it."

"Mum! You should have known better."

"I know, but I couldn’t help it. It’s such an unusual painting, especially with a name. You can guess what he said."

Jess didn’t need to guess. She knew Grandpa would say, "It’s not the artist's job to explain a painting. Each painting has its own life and language, like a poem. We either understand it or we don’t." He would say painting is hard work, and he doesn’t have time to explain to everyone.

Mum laughed and said, "Something like that. I was hoping you might know something about this painting since you seem to inspire him."

"Inspire?" Jess asked.

"Yes, someone who helps an artist."

Jess knew what it meant. Grandpa often said it when she watched him paint. But she thought he meant a goddess, not a real person. It was hard to think anyone could inspire someone as strong-willed as Grandpa. 

"He doesn’t need me to inspire him," she said. "He has been painting all his life."

This morning, I woke up and accidentally cut a hole in my bedroom carpet. I didn’t mean to do it. I could have tripped over the bed with Dad’s knife in my hand, and the knife might have gone into the carpet. That could have happened, but I’m not saying it did. I just didn’t plan to damage the carpet. I didn’t wake up and think, “Today I will cut a hole in my carpet.” It seemed like a good idea at the time, but later I wondered why I thought that. This happens to me a lot. 

What I was really doing was trying to fit my corner cabinet into a corner. My Gran gave me the cabinet when she moved to a flat. It is very cute! It is small, painted white, and has pink and blue flowers on it. It has tiny glass doors. Gran used to keep pretty china ornaments in it. I keep my shells and stones there. Gran knew I loved her cabinet, and I was very happy when she gave it to me!

The cabinet is a corner cabinet, so it has to go in a corner. My bedroom is the smallest room in the house, and it is shaped like a wedge of cheese. My parents have the big front bedroom, my sister Angela has the back room, and my brother Tom has the little room over the garage. I have the smallest room, which is like a broom cupboard. Mum says when Angela goes to university, Tom can have her room, and I can have Tom’s room. But since Angela is only fifteen, I think I will be in my small room for a long time. 

I don’t mind; I like my little bedroom. It is cozy, like a nest. I love the sloping roof and the window at floor level. The only problem is that there are not many corners! My bed is in one corner, and my wardrobe is in the other. I tried to fit Gran’s cabinet in the space between the roof and the floor, but it was a little too tall. 

Then I thought, if I can’t cut the cabinet, maybe I can cut a hole in the carpet! It seemed like a good idea. Dad always tells us to “think outside the box,” and that is what I was trying to do!

The novel "The Borrowers" is about a family of tiny people who live secretly in the walls and floors of a house. They borrow things from normal-sized people to survive. When I was asked to make a TV show from the book, I knew it would be hard to meet people’s expectations. Fans of the book have strong ideas about how it should be. I used the original drawings from the book a lot because I didn’t want people to say I did it wrong.

The author wanted the show to show things from the Borrowers' point of view, not from the humans'. This made filming more difficult. The Borrowers are ten times smaller than humans, so when we filmed them walking across a room, we had to be ten times further away than usual. The crew had to crawl on the ground and film from very low, about 15 centimeters high, to show the Borrowers' view. They went through many pairs of jeans!

We only raised the cameras for special shots. One big challenge was making the shadows look right when we combined the tiny Borrowers with the normal-sized background. We created a special way to do this. After the show was on TV, famous director George Lucas called me to ask how I did it.

We built only one set, which was the Borrowers' home under the floorboards. It was filled with giant objects to make the actors look small. It was very fun. I remember the coins we used; they were bigger than dinner plates and hard to lift. We often had to stop filming because the crew laughed so much. In the story, there is a scene where the Borrowers go down a drain. To film this, the actors had to go down a tunnel with hoses, and they said it was so scary that they didn’t need to act.

It was important to me to get the costumes right. I had them made from heavy canvas so they looked like doll clothes. This made it hard for the main actress to move. She couldn’t sit down during breaks and had to be sewn into her dress every morning. The lead actor wore trousers made from a rug because normal fabric looked too smooth. Unfortunately, it was very hot while we filmed, and I don’t think they were happy with me about the costumes!

Most of the action away from the Borrowers' home was filmed with the actors in front of a blue screen. It was hard for them to act with things that weren’t really there. I had to draw pictures of every scene to show how they should look. I made 2,000 drawings! We didn’t have enough money to use special effects studios during the day, so I worked nights for three months. We had to work quickly. One time, I filmed a whole scene and then realized there was no film in the camera! But in the end, everything came together, and I think the show was successful in showing the magic of the books.

Mom stops the car at the corner of my new school, Palm Grove High School. She looks around nervously, expecting to see reporters, but there are none. I know that soon things will get crazy. It always happens. People will smile at me, want to be my friend, and ask for free tickets to my dad’s concerts. “Everything will be fine,” I tell her. She kisses her fingertip and touches my cheek before I get out of the car. Then she drives away, leaving me alone at this new school. But I wanted this. I wanted to leave my old life of traveling and tutors. While the rest of the band is here for recording, we are staying for good. I wanted to come to this school to meet normal kids. I want to meet kids with parents who have regular jobs, like working in an office or cutting grass. That would be so cool.

I walk into the school office. “Hi, I need my schedule, please,” I say to the secretary. “Name?” she asks, looking unfriendly. “Desert McGraw.” “Desirée?” she asks, leaning closer. “Desert,” I say again. The secretary looks confused. “Oh,” she says and types my last name. That’s good because not many people know my last name since my dad uses a stage name. “What grade?” she asks. “Eleventh.” “One second, it’s printing,” she replies. Then she gives me the paper. My first class is English Literature. Great! I like English. But I will be late. English is in Room 214 on the second floor. I studied the map last night so I wouldn’t look silly trying to find my classes.

When I reach the door, I hear the teacher calling names. “Aurelio Gonzalez.” “Here.” I quietly enter and sit at the back of the class. The girl next to me smiles. She looks at my normal outfit – jeans and a T-shirt. “Nice shoes,” she whispers. I look down at my fancy shoes with flowers. Oh no, I shouldn’t have worn these. “Thanks,” I say. The teacher stops calling names. “Desert... McGraw?” she says. “Here.” The teacher smiles and introduces herself as Ms. Smigla. She talks a lot and gives us our course outlines. After that, she lets us talk to each other! All teachers should do this.

“Why did you move here?” my new friend asks. I have a few answers. I could say I wanted a normal life away from cameras and reporters. Or I could say what my dad thinks: “We need a change, Desert,” he said. “This is the perfect place to record the new album.” I think he just wants to relax at the beach. Why else would they choose a studio so close to the sand? “My dad had to move,” I tell her. “What does he do?” she asks. I know everyone will find out soon, but I can pretend to be normal for a while. “He’s an artist,” I say, playing with my backpack zipper. “Cool. I’m Becca, by the way.” She doesn’t seem to care much. That’s good.

Not only is the average American teenage girl expected to be the president of the Student Council, but she also needs to have a part-time job, volunteer, and do well in school. This is what it means to be a teenager in America today. Boys and girls cannot just go to school and be average because being average is not enough anymore. People think that if you do not try very hard, you are lazy.

Teenager Kristen Loose says, “Adults forget how much pressure we have. We have a lot of homework, tests, after-school activities, jobs, chores, and we also want to have a social life.” Even with all this stress, people still have negative ideas about teenagers. They think teenagers are lazy, disrespectful, loud, and only care about themselves. While some teenagers may act this way, it is not fair to say all teenagers are like this.

Kristen Loose believes that many people think teenagers only use their phones to watch TV or play games. She says this is not true. She uses her phone to help her with school and to stay in touch with people. Today, students can do their homework anywhere because of smartphones and social media. They can listen to lessons while going to school. Schoolwork does not stop when they leave school; it is always there, and they have to pay attention to it all the time.

Many teenagers wake up around 6 a.m. or 7 a.m. and often go to bed after midnight. They have a busy schedule with school, activities, family duties, and homework. They do not get enough sleep. The US National Sleep Foundation found that about 20 percent of teenagers get the recommended nine hours of sleep each night. Also, 28 percent of teens said they fall asleep in school about once a week because they are tired.

Teenager Lindamarie Olsen says she has about 18 hours of free time each week. With 168 hours in a week, 18 hours is not much. She does not spend her free time on social media or TV. Instead, she likes to volunteer. She says, “People think teenagers only care about themselves, but I love helping others. I want to make a positive difference in my school and community.”

In 20 years, the ideas about teenagers may change, but they will still be working hard and making the world better. There will always be new students who are doing great things before they finish school.

The Earth to Sky Calculus Club is a group of teenagers who live in Bishop, a small mountain town in the US. This town is surrounded by nature and is near the Sierra Nevada mountains. In the last few years, the club has sent over fifty balloons high into the sky, about 35 kilometers above the Earth. This project is a mix of science and adventure, which is why many teenagers want to join.

One weekend in late spring, I joined them as they prepared to release a balloon. They wanted to see shooting stars, which are bright lights in the sky caused by rocks or metal from space entering the Earth's atmosphere. As it got dark, the teenagers attached a soft lunch box to the bottom of the balloon. Inside the lunch box were a camera, a tool to measure how high the balloon went, and a thermometer to check the temperature. They also put two GPS trackers on the outside to help find the lunch box later.

A gas tank, given by a friend from another state, was used to fill the balloon with gas. The balloon grew to the size of a small car. An older boy drove for seven hours to get the gas tank. He said, “I didn’t really mind.” For these kids, this is normal.

Finally, it was time for the balloon to go up. They counted down, “Five, four, three, two, one,” and the balloon started to rise. Some of the teenagers ran after it with flashlights, trying to see it in the dark sky. There was a quiet moment of wonder as the balloon disappeared into the night.

After the launch, most students went home, but a few stayed to watch for shooting stars. They lay on blankets and looked at the clear sky, which was surprising because it was only four hours from Los Angeles, a big city with about 4 million people. I saw a boy get into a sleeping bag and fall asleep. One girl said quietly, “We're the only ones talking.” Another girl whispered, “I know.” Suddenly, a meteor flew across the sky.

As the balloon went higher, it got bigger until it popped with a loud bang. A parachute helped the lunch box land safely back on Earth. The students would find it the next day using the GPS trackers. Finding it was not easy, but that was part of the fun. There is not much land with people around Bishop, so the lunch box usually lands in a remote area.

The group’s leader said, “Recoveries are a huge part of the program.” They had only lost two lunch boxes in 53 launches. He explained that this project helps them learn about the land in a way they usually do not.

This time, the lunch box landed 84 kilometers west of Bishop. To get it, the team had to drive south and then back up the mountains. They had to decide if they should drive or walk, especially if the lunch box was on a high mountain or in a tall tree. The leader said, “These students know the Eastern Sierra well. What seems wild to some is normal for others.”

In the end, it took them 11 hours to find the lunch box. It was in a canyon, on a flat rock, near a waterfall. The camera did not catch any shooting stars, which was a little disappointing. But it gave them a chance to talk about science and share another adventure story with anyone who asked.

Chloe Morgan did not like science, especially Palaeontology, until she was fifteen years old. It happened by chance. Her younger brother was very interested in dinosaurs, which she did not care about at first. She helped him with a science project and found an article about new dinosaur discoveries. This surprised her, and she decided she wanted to study Palaeontology.

Chloe remembers meeting her first professional palaeontologist, Matt Cornelius. He was young and already famous. She was nervous to meet him because she thought he might find her annoying. But he was friendly and listened to her questions, which made her feel better.

Chloe thinks movies like Jurassic Park have made many people interested in dinosaurs. However, she believes that palaeontologists are often shown in a wrong way in films. They are either seen as strange geniuses or as silly people who cannot talk to others. She says movies do not show what palaeontologists really do.

In her job, Chloe does many things. She digs up dinosaur bones, works in labs to study fossils, and writes scientific papers. Sometimes, she talks to the public about science, especially to young people. She wants them to understand science better and get excited about it. Talking about dinosaurs can help children learn about nature and other science topics.

Chloe worked on a TV documentary called Walking with Dinosaurs. She helped make sure the dinosaurs were shown correctly. She did not have to change much because the show was accurate. The dinosaurs in this program look more real than those in movies like Jurassic Park.

Chloe believes dinosaurs are still interesting to people because they make us curious. They remind us that there is still much to discover in the world. Palaeontology allows us to learn about the past, like a journey through time.

When you travel by car with your family, even if you are six years old, you know you are not at your destination yet. You keep asking, "Are we there yet?" But when you arrive, it is not "there" anymore; it is "here." If you think you are "there," you should ask, "Are we here yet?" 

Parents often hear this question many times during long car trips. Kids might think they have a hard time, but they can relax in the back seat. They can watch DVDs, listen to music, or do puzzles while looking at the beautiful views outside. Meanwhile, one of the parents is in the front seat, giving out juice boxes and cookies, and making sure everything is okay.

But sometimes, things can get a little crazy. For example, my younger brother, Tim, might put his foot on my side of the seat. I don’t like that, so I put my foot on his side. Soon, we are fighting, and our parents have to tell us to stop and stay in our own seats. This helps for a while, and we can enjoy the views again.

Then, when I try to read, I feel something strange on my arm. The window is closed, but Tim is quietly blowing his breath on me. He is not touching me, so he thinks it is okay. This makes me angry, and we start fighting again. Our parents have to separate us, and the car swerves a bit.

Over the years, Dad has found ways to deal with us. When we ask, "Are we there yet?" he sometimes says, "Yes, we are here. Get out of the car." But we are still driving on the highway. Then he says, "Maybe we are not there yet." This makes us quiet for a while.

You can tell when you finally arrive because the adults get out of the car and move away from the kids. So remember, if your parents are still close enough to answer your question, the answer is: no, you are not there yet.

John and Zuzi Morgan have opened a café in Oxford, UK. In their café, people can enjoy coffee and cake while playing board games. They hope that customers will love the experience and come back again. Zuzi says they wanted to create a place where people can connect without using their phones or screens. 

The games played in their café are called "Eurogames." These games have simple themes, like farming and building. The first Eurogame was called The Settlers of Catan, made by a German designer named Klaus Teuber. In this game, players build settlements on an island and trade resources with each other. Everyone stays involved and has fun until the end of the game.

There are also "co-operative" games where all players work together to win or lose as a team. One popular co-operative game is Pandemic, created by Matt Leacock. In Pandemic, players work together to solve global problems. Leacock was inspired by a Eurogame called Lord of the Rings, which is based on a famous book. He remembers feeling scared and excited when he played it with friends. 

Leacock loved board games as a child, but sometimes he felt disappointed when they did not work well. With help from his uncle, he tried to make better games. Pandemic became very popular and included a lot of storytelling, similar to video games. 

The rise of video games has helped board games become more popular. Many people now play games on their phones. Ben Hogg, who works for a game company, says that everyone plays games on their smartphones. 

At first, video games allowed people to play together in the same room. But then, many games moved online, and players could not see each other. Some people who liked video games wanted to play games with friends in person again. 

In John and Zuzi's busy café, board games are more than just fun. In our online world, games are a way for people to connect and share experiences together. This trend is likely to continue.

Jamie Scott is a musician from the UK. He has written and produced many popular songs. His story shows that hard work and not giving up are very important in music, even if you start slowly. Jamie says his mother was a great singer and she helped him learn to play the guitar. He only listened to a local radio station for older people when he was young, so he did not hear new songs until he was 12 years old.

When he was a teenager, Jamie had to choose between playing tennis and making music. He played tennis at a high level, but he liked music more. He spent his lunch breaks in the music room at school, playing the piano. At 17, he left school to become a performer. He started a music duo with a friend who played guitar but did not want to be a performer.

Jamie told his parents that he wanted to make music. His dad said he had 18 months to succeed, or he would need to find a job. After some close calls with music companies, he got a deal with a publisher at 19 because of one song. However, the music companies wanted him to be a solo artist, so he had to leave his friend.

Jamie found success as a songwriter instead of a performer. After some hard times with a record label in the UK, he changed to another label to release a new album, but he did not become famous right away. He felt like he was often in the wrong place at the wrong time. However, as a songwriter, he felt he was in the right place.

He believes he is one of the main songwriters in the UK that new artists come to for help. Sometimes, he tells artists that it is okay to write songs that people will love. He wants to write big songs that can be very popular. Jamie is honest about wanting to create music that can be number one on the charts. He knows he has a talent for it and focuses on making great music. He wants to write songs that will be loved by many people, not just what is popular at the moment.

Tony Connor is a new kind of celebrity. He is very popular online, but many people, like me, do not know him because we do not watch videos of people doing tricks on bikes. He is a "street trials cyclist." This means he jumps from hard places, like roofs or walls, to land safely in other strange places. People film these jumps and share them online.

I met Tony one Saturday morning at a BMX park. The local kids all know him, and some older people come to say hello and call him "an absolute legend." After watching him, I agree with them. At first, I was unsure about him, but I was impressed by his bravery and creativity. Before each jump, he explains what he wants to do, and sometimes I think he cannot do it. But when I tell him he did a great job, he seems not to care much about my praise.

Even though he is famous online, Tony says he does not like being a celebrity. He finds it hard to talk to fans. He prefers to do things instead of just talking about them. This is funny because his fame comes from social media and the small cameras that help make these videos. He says, "This technology helps people like me earn money." Sometimes he feels like everyone is filming themselves or looking at screens, and he does not like that.

Tony makes a good living from his videos, which is different from the past when this was just a hobby. After many years of talking to top athletes, I learned that two important things help a child become a great athlete: energy and the ability to handle disappointment. These qualities can be more important than talent. The riskier the sport, the more mental strength you need. 

Even in the park, Tony fell a few times on what he thought were easy obstacles. He just got up and kept trying until he could do it. Some people do not see him as a hero. They think he takes too many risks. He says, "People who say this may care, but they do not understand. They probably have never tried riding a trials bike and do not know the sport. I get advice from experts to stay safe."

Tony is careful about the risks he takes. He explains, "People are different. Some are not scared, and they should not do these sports. It is smart to know the dangers. Some people cannot get over their fear, but I can. I feel scared but find a way to keep going. I am not addicted to risk. I spend a lot of time planning and getting ready. Sometimes I ride around to prepare myself before trying a new jump. I know I must stay calm before I jump. If I focus completely, I will be fine."

Television presenter Helen Skelton has done many dangerous challenges to help charity. She has run a marathon in the desert and traveled down the Amazon river in a small boat. For her latest challenge, Helen walked on a high wire. This wire was 66 meters above the ground, between two tall towers of an empty power station. There was no safety net. She only had a belt around her waist that was attached to another wire above her. To help her stay balanced and not fall, she used a long stick that weighed eight kilograms.

Helen learned from an expert high-wire walker. She already had some circus skills, but she found out that walking on a high wire was very different. “The training was a shock,” said Helen. “I didn’t know I needed to be so strong. Every day started at 8 am with a run up a steep hill. Then I did an hour of exercises, and another hour practicing on the wire. I also had to learn how to fall onto the wire so I could keep going if I slipped. Every time I fell, it hurt a lot. But I had to stay positive: if I was nervous and started shaking, the wire would shake too!”

On the day of the challenge, it was windy. Helen took deep breaths to control herself as she moved step by step on the wire. The 150-meter walk took 15 minutes. “That was the scariest thing I’ve done,” she said after. “I’m glad it’s over!” But this experience did not stop Helen from planning her next charity project: to reach the South Pole by ski, kite, and bike.

In 2006, Jeff Somers started a trip around the world on a penny farthing. This is an old bicycle with one big wheel and one small wheel. Before this, he wrote a book about his travels in Canada using a 50-year-old car. He loved cars and worked on racing car engines. To save money, Jeff rode an old bicycle to work and used it to go on holiday to Amsterdam. He said, “That trip opened my eyes. I decided to see the world by bike.”

Jeff did not want a normal bike. He wanted to build a special one. He thought a penny farthing was the craziest bike he could make, so he went to a museum to learn how they were made. After trying to start his trip in 2001 and 2003 but stopping because of a knee injury, he finally began his journey in 2006. He traveled for three years and visited 23 countries on four continents. The best part of his trip was arriving in Tibet and seeing Mount Everest. 

He met other cyclists who could ride up mountains, but he was happy with his penny farthing. People were very surprised to see it as he traveled further from home. His worst moment was when he had to drink dirty water from a stream. He got very sick and stayed in a hostel for ten days without medicine. He had no money for a hospital or to go home. 

Even with these problems, Jeff now says, “If I could afford it, I would start traveling again tomorrow on my penny farthing.”

I work at a university in the US. My team and I are learning about water birds, especially the American black duck. We just started using a new tool called a ‘night-vision scope’. This tool helps us see the ducks at night! 

We are worried about black ducks because their numbers are very low. We don’t know if there is enough food for them on the east coast. We have a lot of information about what they do during the day, but we don’t know what they do at night. This is because we didn’t have the right equipment before. The new scope will give us clear pictures, even when there is no moon. This will help us learn more and take better care of their home.

Our work is hard. There are four of us, and we each work six hours a day. We have studied ducks in different places. Sometimes, I have to take a boat to see the ducks and write down what I find. The weather can be difficult. Some nights are warm, but many nights are wet. It is very quiet, so I drink a lot of coffee to stay awake! 

We have only missed one workday because the snow was too deep for our special vehicles. I like this challenge, especially when I think about summer. In summer, we will work in a laboratory and look at our results together. It will be hard to be inside, but it is important. I wouldn’t change this job for anything!

Whenever I tell people about my job, they are surprised. But I am not joking! I spend my days at work eating chocolate! Tasting chocolate is very important to make sure customers get the best chocolate from my company. Every week, I get small samples from our factory. I check them for taste, texture, and smell. I also taste the raw materials we use, like nuts and fruit. I choose the best ones to put in the chocolate.

Next to my office, I have a kitchen where I can test and taste the products I make. I also share samples with my colleagues! My kitchen has many machines and ingredients to use. It is great to have my own space during the day. No two days are the same in this job. Sometimes I work in our food lab, and other times I travel to buy raw materials. This can be hard because I have a young family. But I love the variety in my job, even more than the chocolate!

People often ask me if I get bored of chocolate. I have worked with it for a long time, and I still love to eat it. In fact, I often go home and eat more chocolate in the evening!

Have you ever thought about what it is like to perform in a circus? Sophia Grayson works at Circus Experience, a place that teaches young people circus skills. She says her course is popular because it teaches many skills. Students learn to juggle, throw and catch things like balls or even fire. They also learn trapeze, which is flying in the air above an audience.

The course lasts one year. Students slowly take more risks in each class, and parents can come to some classes to see how their children are doing. Sophia explains that circus performers need to do different things all the time. It is important to keep performances exciting. To be successful in the circus, you must practice a lot. 

Another great part of being in the circus is making friends with other performers and learning from them. Being fit is very important too. Circus artists, like athletes, train every day to stay strong. Training is important, but the best performers are those who want to succeed, have good ideas, and always want to get better.

Some people think circus performers get hurt a lot or only work for a short time each year. But the real challenge is thinking about the future. You can only travel and perform when you are young, and later you need to think about other jobs. 

The course also teaches business planning. Many past students have started their own businesses around the world and are happy to share their stories. However, Sophia warns that being in the circus is not a way to make a lot of money. “The work usually does not give you a regular salary. It is also very competitive, but it is a lot of fun!”

You may not know her name or face, but you have probably heard her many times. Mariam Hobson is a backing singer. This means she sings in the background to help the main singer. Many people think backing singers are not as good as lead singers, but that is not true. They often have to be even better! People like Mariam are very important in music.

Mariam loves her job because every time she goes to the recording studio, she does not know what she will sing. It could be classical music, jazz, hip hop, or rock. Sometimes, she even sings funny songs for radio or ads. She is often surprised by what the producers ask her to do. Once, they asked her to sing like a fish underwater! But she never complains; she just does her job.

To be a good backing singer, you need to be very good at music and learn quickly. Sometimes, there is no music sheet to read. Mariam remembers her first time recording music for a film. It was hard because there were eight singers, each singing a different part, and there was also an orchestra. She was scared because if she made a mistake, they would have to record everything again, and nobody likes that. Recording can take a long time.

One of Mariam's favorite jobs is recording for songwriters. Some new writers do not know what type of music is best for a female voice. When they hear Mariam sing their song, they can see how to make it better.

Julie Deane started her business with only a little knowledge about fashion. She makes and sells ‘satchels’, which are traditional bags for schoolchildren. These bags are now sold in famous shops and many celebrities use them. 

Before she chose to make satchels, Julie thought about other business ideas, like cake decorating and party planning. She wanted to be sure about her choice. Some people told her that no one would want the bags, but Julie believed in her idea. She worked with her mother, who had never worked before but was good at business. The design of the satchels was inspired by children’s storybooks.

At first, Julie did not know much about fashion blogs, but they helped her business grow. She started by selling one satchel a week. To get more attention, she sent satchels to fashion writers and hoped they would write about them. They did, and more people became interested in her bags. Now, Julie enjoys seeing which celebrity is seen with a satchel!

While other companies spend money on online ads, Julie uses the internet to get ideas for new styles. There was a tough time when another company copied her design, so now she makes sure she trusts her production team as much as her own staff. People who visit her office say it feels positive and happy. There is a new factory, but it is the team that makes the place special.

When Vicky Harmiston was a child, her parents let her and her brother Jamie choose what to do in their free time. Vicky liked to play many sports. She was a good swimmer, and her coach thought she could be a champion. But the swimming club was far from her home, so it was hard for her to train and do her schoolwork.

When they were teenagers, Jamie loved cycling. He bought a special racing bike and started to compete. Vicky thought it looked fun and wanted to try it too. She says it was the best choice she ever made. Soon, she was cycling every day and doing very well. The track was close to her school, so it was easy for her to go to training after school.

Vicky became a successful track cyclist and won many competitions. When she was 28, she stopped competing. Vicky said, “I loved winning for many years, but I started to feel tired of it. When the fun stops, there is no reason to continue. Luckily, I found a new job.”

Vicky got a job with a charity called CycleZone. She said, “We help young people who have never liked sports. The first thing we do is teach them to ride a bike. We want them to believe in themselves and what they can do. CycleZone is great because it brings young people together.”

The charity uses famous people to help promote their work. Vicky said, “Some people think having a celebrity help is not always good for a charity. They say celebrities do it for their own fame, and this can hide the real work of the charity. But if famous singers and actors can help, I think they should.”

Ana Ronson is a singer-songwriter from Ireland. Her parents did not play music, but there was always music in her home. Her grandfather played the guitar and taught Ana and her brother how to play.

The first time Ana sang in front of people was at school. She was very nervous, and her teacher had to help her off the stage. The teacher suggested that Ana join the school theatre club to help her feel more confident. After some time in the club, Ana sang happily with 50 other students at a concert.

A year later, her brother, who was in a band, asked her to write a song for them. Ana wrote her first song called "Falling Stars" in just three days. She enjoyed writing so much that she took a songwriting course with a professional. Even though she was the youngest student, she knew a lot about music. But Ana felt the teacher did not listen to her, so she wrote a song called "Something to Say" about her feelings. She shared this song online, and many people loved it.

Joss Alton, who owns a music company called Isotope Music, flew from far away to ask Ana to join his company. At first, Ana was unsure because she did not know much about Isotope and did not want anyone to tell her what to sing. But Joss convinced her that this would not happen. Soon after, Ana performed at a concert in Dublin organized by Isotope. The tickets sold out quickly, and it was a wonderful night.

Ana prefers to write songs about difficult times in life rather than happy times. One of her favorite songs is "Decision," which is about why her brother stopped singing for a while and how sad it made him. Ana hopes her fans will like her songs, but she wants to write about her own important experiences.

Last year, I went on a great trip. I traveled by boat on a guided tour along the west coast of Canada. It was my brother Harry’s idea. He is a journalist, like me, and he wanted to write stories about the trip. He loves boats, but I do not share that interest. I had always wanted to visit this area because I saw it on TV when I was a child. I knew it was where our great-grandparents lived before they moved to Europe. So, I kept asking Harry if I could go with him, and he finally said yes!

A few days before we left, there were storms where we were going. But the weather was supposed to be nice when we arrived. I was busy with work and did not have much time to prepare. But Harry said he would take care of everything, so I felt better.

When we got to Canada, we joined the group, packed our things into small boats, and started our journey. The guide told us that very few people live along that coast. On the first morning, we only saw dolphins and birds. We could see islands in the distance, but the fog made it hard to see far. I enjoyed watching the beautiful patterns our boat made in the water.

We often stopped to explore the rock pools on the beaches. They were full of colorful fish, many of which I did not know. I loved not worrying about time. We always remembered to make lunch and dinner together over campfires. At night, we slept on the boats. The beds were hard, but it felt nice to be free from stress.

When it was time to go home, I felt sad. I did not want to return to normal life. But I knew I would miss my family and friends. I was also excited to tell everyone at home about our adventures!

My dad was a professional basketball player in Germany, just like his dad before him. When I was a kid, I went to many of his games. You might think I would love basketball, but I didn’t. I liked to tell my friends how good my dad was, especially when he won, but I often read a book instead of watching the games.

When I started secondary school, I was still two years away from being a teenager, but I was already two meters tall. My sports teacher saw my height and asked if I wanted to train with the basketball team. I enjoyed the training, but I thought I needed to get better before playing in a real game. The teacher believed in me more than I believed in myself. After some time, I agreed to play, and a few weeks later, I played against another school. My parents came to watch, which made me nervous, but it was okay in the end!

For the next four years, I practiced every day and did very well. I even joined an adult team before I moved to a special sports academy in the USA when I was fifteen. The coach there trains Olympic basketball players, and it was amazing to work with him. However, I didn’t enjoy living far from my parents at first. At home, I couldn’t spend much time with my friends because of all the training, so that part was not new for me. I got used to my new life, and my English got better quickly!

I became a professional player at eighteen, three years after arriving in the USA. I was taller than most players in the league since I was fifteen, but I needed to gain weight to play better. My coach knew a team that would take me while I was still in college, so I joined them and have never regretted it.

Seven years ago, I was studying Tourism at college. I needed a part-time job because my course was expensive. I decided to train as a weekend tour guide in my home city, Chicago, USA. I took visitors around the city, and I was surprised at how much I enjoyed it. I saw my city in a new way every time!

After I finished my studies, I wanted to be a tour guide full-time. I thought it would be easy, but I learned that I needed to know a lot more. To get a licence as a full-time tour guide, I had to answer many questions about Chicago, like its buildings, history, and public transport rules. After a few months of hard work, I got my tour guide qualification and became an independent tour guide.

Being a tour guide is not just about knowing facts. You also need to be entertaining and tell interesting stories. It is important to handle unexpected situations, like if a place is closed when you arrive. Tourists want to enjoy their tour, not hear about problems. I want my visitors to be happy, so they will leave good reviews online. Good reviews help me get more customers.

I try to make my tours fun and easy for everyone. Because I love my job and put a lot of energy into it, I usually get very good reviews. Many visitors recommend my tours to others coming to Chicago.

My name is Ella, and I am 22 years old. Last year, I went to Thailand for two weeks with my sister, Josie. She is five years younger than me, but we get along well. We went to help at an elephant sanctuary. This is a place where people take care of sick and rescued elephants. At first, I was not sure if we would fit in with the other volunteers because they were older than us. We were also nervous because it was our first time doing this kind of work. But in the end, we had nothing to worry about.

One of our main jobs was to collect food for the elephants. Elephants eat a lot of grass and banana plants, so this took most of the day. Josie found it hard work, but I thought it was worth it to see the elephants enjoy their food. We also helped wash the elephants in the river with big brushes and soap. I had a lot of fun, even though I got wetter than the elephants!

The part of the day I liked the most was the evening. By the light of the moon, we walked the elephants into the forest where they slept at night. All the volunteers stayed in the same house. Josie and I shared a small bedroom because she did not want to be alone. It was hot and humid at night, but we expected that. The meals were delicious and did not have meat, which we do not like.

After dinner, all the volunteers and staff talked and played games together. Now that we are back in the UK, Josie does not often talk about Thailand. But if someone asks her if she liked her time at the sanctuary, she says she loved it. I think she might be a little upset with herself because she missed her friends too much and did not enjoy it fully. But when she thinks back, she can see how lucky she was to go there. Maybe she will go back one day – I know I will!

My name is Gina D’Costa, and I have a flower shop in the UK. We sell flowers to many different customers. Hotels and offices often buy flowers for their reception areas. Sometimes, we provide flowers for businesses to use in their advertising photos. Once, I even decorated a castle with flowers for a wedding. It was a lot of work, but I was very proud of it.

My day starts at 4 a.m. I go to the market to buy fresh flowers. Most people are still sleeping, and my friends think I am crazy, but I love my job. It is often cold and dark at that time, but I don’t let it bother me. The flower market is amazing, with flowers from all over the world. The sights and smells make it hard to choose. If I were buying for myself, I would choose only pink flowers because they are my favorite. But I have to remember that what I like is not always what my customers want. 

Not all flowers are available all year, so I cannot always find what customers want. I don’t like arguing about prices with the flower sellers, but I have to do it. Flowers can be expensive, so I try to get the best price.

When I am back at the shop, we look at customer orders and prepare vases with the flowers I bought. Then, we make flower bunches and calculate the costs. Customers are often surprised by the prices, and I sometimes ask them to think again about what they want. Some people might think this is too much trouble, but I enjoy finding the best flowers for the money someone wants to spend. I love my job and wouldn’t want to do anything else!

My city has a modern cinema that shows the latest films and many kids' films on weekends. It is close to my home, but a year ago, I felt something was missing. I wanted to talk about films with other people after watching them. So, I started a film club with two friends!

We decided not to rent a cinema. Instead, we choose a different place in the city each month. For example, we used an old factory to show a film set in Antarctica. It was very cold, which made it a great place for the film. Some places we use are free because the owners sell snacks during the film. This helps us keep our prices low. We just want to cover our costs, not make money.

Each time we show a film, it gets easier for us, especially now that we have our own equipment. We can see how many tickets we sell online, so we don’t worry about empty seats. There is still a lot to do, but when people of all ages tell us they had a great time, it makes us happy.

Our website helps us a lot, and we are now in touch with other film clubs in the country. We have visited them to see how they do things, but we always like coming back to our own club! We also started a blog because many people look for film information online instead of reading local papers. We have put up some posters in cafés, but the best way to get new people is when others tell their friends about us. The audience loves the fun activities we have with each film. Last month, we had a movie quiz that everyone enjoyed!

Taking photographs was my favorite thing to do when I was a child. When I was 15, I wanted to make my hobby better. So, I decided to start a special project: I would take one photo every day for a whole year. Many other young photographers had done this before, but I thought it was a great idea, so I began.

After a few weeks, I put my photos on a website for young photographers. I wanted to create a photo diary and show my photos to others. I was surprised to find that people liked my photos. I enjoyed taking pictures of many different things. Then, someone suggested that I should focus on one topic for my photos. I agreed and decided to take more pictures of nature, especially birds and the sky.

Most of my photos were black and white, which was different from what many other young photographers were doing. They were taking color photos. Sometimes, I doubted my project and almost gave up. But in the end, I trusted myself and became more confident in my style.

One day, I showed my project to my art teacher. She told me about a photography competition for young people. I entered some of my photos just for fun. I will never forget when the judges told me I won first prize. I was so happy because my project meant a lot to me. It was the first time I realized that my photography was good, and I could be a professional photographer.

Now, I have my own photography studio, and I have never regretted my choice to be a photographer.

I joined the National Youth Challenge (NYC) last year. I wanted to try camping and sailing, and learn skills like public speaking. These were new things for me. In the NYC, you can do many activities to challenge yourself and learn. There are different levels, from beginner to advanced, and adult volunteers called ‘leaders’ help us. When you finish each level, you get a certificate.

When I first joined, my leader said I should help organize activities at a local children’s club for two hours a week. I was not sure about this because I had joined that club when I was eight. I found it hard to make friends because I was shy, and the other kids already had friends. I stopped going after a few weeks. But I decided to take the challenge because I wanted my first NYC certificate.

Soon, I wanted to spend all my free time at the children’s club. It became more important to me than just getting the certificate. When I finished the challenge, the NYC leader let me keep volunteering at the club because I made good friends with the children. Now, I go there for about four hours a week, and I always look forward to it.

Because of what I learned at the children’s club, I want to go to college after school to become a youth worker. A youth worker is someone who helps children. I never thought about this job before I started at the club. This has been my favorite part of the NYC, and I have improved my communication skills while helping others. I have several NYC certificates now, and one of them is for camping!

I was born in Denver, USA. I started snowboarding when I was eight years old. My dad took me to a place in the mountains, about two hours from Denver. The hill looked very steep, and my dad had to convince me to try snowboarding. I was too young to ask him if I could start, but he loved snowboarding and wanted me to enjoy it too. He made it look easy, and in the end, I did well. Soon, I loved the sport and got better at it. I began competing when I was ten years old. Some people compete a lot and get bored, but I still love to compete and win. This helps me work harder.

I like not having a strict plan. Sometimes this works out well, like when I became the first girl to get a perfect score of 100 in a local competition. I was not sure I could do the jumps that got me this score until I tried. This made me trust my skills more. In the summer, I train and study because there is no snow. I train every day, but I don’t have to follow a strict diet like in winter. I also spend a lot of time with my friends. This helps me feel better when I can’t do what I love.

I think about my future. Snowboarding is a big part of my life, but I want to have another job too, just in case I don’t become a professional snowboarder or if I get hurt. I am thinking about becoming a doctor if I can find time to go to college. I can’t imagine getting tired of snowboarding, but I know I can’t do it forever.

When I was fifteen, I wanted everything my friends had. I did not think about the future. For example, I did not know what I wanted to do after school. One day, my best friend got a new phone for her birthday. I wanted a new phone too. My parents said I could only have one if I paid for it myself. So, I decided to work part-time and save money. I am thankful to my parents for this because it taught me an important lesson.

I worked every Saturday in a café, but I did not enjoy it much. My parents suggested I start my own small business. I had seen my mum making necklaces, so I asked if I could try it too. I thought it would be hard, but it was easier than I expected. My friends thought it was boring, but I liked the idea. My mum showed me how to make pretty things at home with simple tools.

I sold my first jewellery to my friends and family. They said they liked it, but I was not sure if it was good enough for other people. To find out, I rented a market stall with my mum. There are many tourists where I live, and they bought a lot of my jewellery to take home. Soon, people from all over the country called us to buy more. They thought we were a big company, but it was just me and my mum at the stall!

That made me believe my business could work, so I decided to create a website. Since then, I have made a lot of money from my business, mostly online, but we still have our stall. It has been a lot of fun!

When Janine Stuart was 13 years old, she wrote a book called Being Amelia. This book became very popular. Being Amelia is partly about Janine’s own life. In an interview, Janine said, “Because my father’s job made us move a lot, I learned to make new friends. I know what it is like to be the new student in a class. This helped me write about Amelia, the main character, who starts at a new school. Some funny parts of the book are about Amelia’s home life, especially with her older brother. I am an only child, so I had to use my imagination to write about that.”

Janine started writing her book one summer when she was bored at home. Her mother wanted to be a writer, and her teachers encouraged her to write too. So, writing seemed like a good way to spend her time. The year before, she won a short story competition on a website for young writers. This is why, when Janine finished Being Amelia and sent it to a publishing company, they were excited to read it. They loved the book, and a year later, it was in stores.

One review of Being Amelia says that even though the cover shows happy teenagers, the characters face some hard problems. This makes the story believable. The reviewer thinks that even though Janine is young and her book is not very long, she is a better writer than many famous authors.

Janine is still getting used to being a famous writer. She said, “At first, I hid when people saw me in the street, but now it’s fine. I want to help other young writers, but they need to find their own way. For me, I just need to spend time with my friends, and then I will have something interesting to write about!”

I’m Tom, and I’m fifteen years old. Three years ago, my family and I moved to a castle on a small island. My father got a job as the manager of the castle. He works for a group that takes care of old buildings and keeps them open for visitors. He was happy to get this job, but it took some time for the rest of us to agree. We were worried about living on the island because we thought the castle might not be as nice as our home, and there was no school there.

After we moved, we got used to life on the island. The castle is not very beautiful, but our apartment is comfortable. In summer, the island is friendly and has many visitors, and there are often beach parties. In winter, we only see the other families who live on the island, and there are not many teenagers. The adults help each other with work on the island, which can be hard.

The biggest change for me was taking a boat to my old school every day. I was excited to go on stormy days when there are big waves, but the ferries do not run then! I also learned that if I miss the bus to the harbor after school, I miss the last ferry home, which is scary. So when my friends come to visit, I always tell them to hurry!

We often see beautiful views, especially when the sun sets over the sea. Some days it is very foggy, and you can’t see anything, but then it can be sunny again in a few hours. This still surprises me, even after living here for a long time. We do have bad storms, and I sometimes wonder if the castle is strong enough. But I remember it has been here for many years, and it is still standing!

I live in a house in the beautiful countryside of Scotland. I love nature and wild animals. Six years ago, I started a new hobby – birdwatching! I went to the mountains in northern Scotland with my family. We saw many birds in their natural homes. I spent hours watching them with my parents. They taught me how to tell different types of birds apart and where to find them. It was amazing! After that, I joined a local birdwatchers’ club for young people.

My goal is to see 200 different types of birds. I am almost there! When we go on family holidays, I look for birds from other countries too. We always find places with birdwatching activities so I can see new birds. I have been to Egypt, and last summer we went to South America. I thought I would see my 200th bird there, but it didn’t happen. I learned that you need to be patient with birdwatching.

I made a video about my birdwatching challenge and many teenagers liked it. They said it looked like a fun hobby. My teachers saw the video and asked me to talk about birdwatching at school. I was nervous before I went on stage because all my friends and the whole school were watching me! I felt better when it was over. The teachers said I did a good job and they enjoyed it. I might do another presentation next year!

I am lucky to live in the countryside. I understand why many teenagers in cities might not think about birdwatching, but there are many birds to see in green areas. I think birdwatching clubs should try to get more young people interested in this hobby. Everyone should connect with nature, no matter how old they are, and it doesn’t have to cost a lot of money.

I started playing football when I was 7 years old. I would hurry home from school to play with other kids. I loved it, and soon I became a good player. My family thought I would stop playing like I did with other hobbies, but I didn’t. I dreamed of playing football professionally when I grew up. 

One day, I played in a local tournament. A referee saw me and told the manager of a women’s club to watch me. The manager asked me to join her club. I was surprised because I didn’t know young girls could play in women’s clubs. But the manager liked me, and I started training with a big club when I was 13 years old. I got much better at football.

Some people still doubted I would be a star player, which made me a little sad. But my coach told me to believe in myself. He even let me play in an important match earlier than I thought I would! I ran very hard because I didn’t want to let my team down. Then, by chance, I scored the winning goal! I could hear my coach cheering for me, and after the match, my team carried me around the field. It was amazing! Since then, I have scored many more winning goals.

Next month, my coach and I are organizing a football tournament in my area. We want to get teenagers interested in football and help them meet other players in my club. They will see what it is like to play professionally and feel they can also play for a top team if they work hard. I will tell them what my coach told me – there will be good times and bad times. I have been lucky and had very few bad times!

Text: 

In the UK and around the world, schools and universities are encouraging new students to start doing research early in their studies. Research is not just for famous scholars or scientists. It is a way for everyone to learn and build skills. Research skills are important for your studies and for jobs because they help you think about the world and do your work better.

As a student, you can help create knowledge. You do not just repeat what you learn; you ask questions. You might wonder: Why? How? When? What does this mean? What if things were different? These questions are part of research. 

Research can be very complex, but it can also be simple. It starts with asking questions about everyday things. Most students have done some research before. You have probably asked questions for school projects or at work. You might have researched where to go on holiday, how to grow plants, or how to fix things at home. 

In college and university, you are expected to ask questions, think critically, and explore information. Some students find this hard because in some cultures, knowledge is seen as fixed. They think they should just listen to teachers and books. However, in many places like the UK, US, and Europe, it is important to question what you learn and who teaches it.

This can be challenging, but critical thinking is very important in research. You should not just repeat what you read. Instead, think about it, test it, and see if it makes sense. Do not just accept everything as true. Always question the facts and information you receive.

Cities have always been important places for ideas and creativity. In the past, people met in coffee houses in London to talk about science and politics. In modern Paris, artist Pablo Picasso discussed art in cafés. However, living in a city can be difficult. The same cafés that inspired people also helped spread diseases like cholera. Picasso eventually moved to the countryside.

Today, scientists are studying how city life affects our brains. They found that living in a city can make us feel tired and can even make it harder to think clearly.
