One big reason for this is that cities lack nature. Research shows that hospital patients get better faster when they can see trees from their windows. Even a little bit of nature can help our brains relax and work better.

More people now live in cities than in the countryside. This means we are often surrounded by many strangers in busy places. Living in such crowded areas can affect our mental and physical health. For example, when we walk down a busy street, our brains have to pay attention to many things, like other people and traffic. This can be exhausting because our brains have to work hard to focus.

Natural places are easier for our brains. They help us relax and recharge. This idea is called attention restoration theory, created by psychologist Stephen Kaplan. He believed that being in nature helps our brains recover because nature captures our attention without causing stress.

Before scientists studied this, philosophers and landscape designers warned about the problems of city life and wanted to bring nature into cities. Parks, like Central Park in New York, give people a break from city life. Spending time in a park can help our brains feel better quickly. 

Even though people try many ways to improve their thinking, like energy drinks or changing office designs, walking in nature is often the best solution. Despite the mental challenges of city life, cities continue to grow. Research shows that crowded cities can also be places of creativity. The many social interactions in cities can lead to new ideas and innovations.

So, the challenge is to find ways to reduce the stress of city living while keeping the benefits of being in a city. After all, there are times when people feel tired of nature and want to be in the city again!

**Where Should We Look for the Mind?**

This question might seem strange. We usually think that thinking happens inside our heads. Today, we have advanced machines that can show us this. But I believe we should not only look inside our heads to study the mind. There is a lot of evidence from history that shows objects also help us think. 

For example, tools, jewelry, drawings, and writing have all played important roles in how humans have developed and how we think. So, what is outside our heads might also be part of our minds. 

Many scientists focus on the brain when studying the mind. They often separate people from the things around them to study them better. This is useful for scientists, but it can make us forget that we think with the help of things around us. 

I do not want to say that the brain is not important. Instead, I want to explore the idea that our intelligence connects with the culture and objects around us. This is what my new idea, called Material Engagement Theory (MET), is about. 

MET looks at how objects can help us think. For example, when we make numbers from clay or use a stone to create a tool, these actions show how objects are part of our thinking. MET also studies how this has changed over time and what it means for our thoughts. 

Think about a blind person using a stick. The stick helps the person feel and understand the world. The brain sees the stick as part of the body. This shows that our minds can change and grow when we use new tools. 

My idea sees the mind as something that is always changing. The tools we use, from ancient stone tools to modern smartphones, help us understand and interact with the world. This is why humans create things more than any other species. 

I call this ability to change and grow with objects "metaplasticity." Our minds are flexible and develop as we use the things around us. I want to show that objects are important for understanding how we think. MET helps us see how different tools and technologies have shaped who we are and how we think. 

People often think of technology as something new, but humans have been using tools to change their minds since the beginning of time.

Text: "Photography is one of the most important inventions that changed how we see the world. In the United States, photography became a big part of culture. It is used in many ways, like science, industry, and art, and it also brings fun and entertainment. Historians say photography is one of the greatest contributions of the US to visual arts. 

Photography became popular in the mid-19th century. People liked it because it used machines, which matched their interest in new technology. Just like trains and electricity made travel easier, photography brought images of the world into homes quickly. The camera helped people show who they were and share their lives with others. It also helped families keep memories, even if those memories were not always real.

A photograph shows what the photographer wants us to see. It is different from a drawing because it is a record of real events, people, or things. However, every photograph also shows the photographer's point of view. We might think we understand a photo because we know what it shows, but the meaning can be more complicated. 

To understand a photograph, we need to know why it was taken and how people first saw it. The same photo can mean different things in different places and times. 

For a long time, the importance of the camera in art was not well known. But now, many artists use photographs in their work. For example, Andy Warhol used photographs in his paintings. Today, photography is seen as an important part of art, not separate from painting, but a key part of how we represent things before cameras were invented."

In 1890, William James, an American philosopher and doctor, defined psychology as the "science of mental life." This definition helps us understand psychology even today. Everyone has a mental life, which means we have thoughts and feelings. We can study this in humans, rats, and monkeys, but it can be hard to understand completely.

William James was especially interested in human psychology. He believed it includes basic parts: our thoughts, feelings, the physical world around us, and how we know about these things. Our knowledge is personal and comes from our own experiences. Sometimes, this knowledge is different from scientific facts. Because of this, we often make judgments about psychological issues based on our own experiences. We act like amateur psychologists when we share our opinions about why people behave in certain ways, like feeling insulted or unhappy.

Problems can happen when two people understand things differently. Formal psychology tries to find methods to decide which explanations are correct in different situations. Psychologists help us tell the difference between our personal thoughts, which can be biased, and scientific facts. Psychology is about the mind and brain, but psychologists do not know everything about how the brain works. They study behavior to learn more about our thoughts and feelings.

Studying psychology is like solving a crossword puzzle. It requires careful observation and analysis. Psychologists want to describe, understand, predict, and learn how to change the processes they study. When they achieve these goals, they can help us understand our experiences and improve people's lives. For example, psychology has helped in teaching children to read better, designing safer machines, and helping people express their feelings when they are upset.

Although people have talked about psychological questions for a long time, scientific study of psychology has only happened in the last 150 years. Early psychologists used introspection, which means looking at one's own thoughts and feelings, to find answers. While this is still interesting, it has limitations. William James said that trying to understand the mind this way is like trying to see in the dark. Today, psychologists prefer to base their theories on careful observations of others' behavior instead of just their own experiences.

In a storehouse in a business park in Michigan, USA, there is a special place called the Museum of Failed Products. This museum shows products that people did not want to buy. Some examples are A Touch of Yogurt shampoo and Breakfast Cola. The museum is owned by a company called GfK. Carol Sherry, who runs the museum, believes that each product has a sad story about the people who tried to sell it.

It is surprising that this museum exists as a business. Many companies do not keep samples of their failed products. Robert McMath, who started the museum, wanted to collect new products, not just the ones that failed. He began this in the 1960s. He learned that most products do not succeed. Because he collected many new items, most of them ended up being unsuccessful.

Today, many products in the museum were once thought to be good ideas. People in meetings did not see that these products would fail. Sometimes, marketers put more money into a bad product to try to sell it, instead of figuring out what went wrong. This idea of always being positive is also common in self-help advice. One popular idea is "positive visualization," which means if you think good things will happen, they will.

However, research by psychologist Gabriele Oettingen shows that thinking too much about how well things could go can actually make people less motivated to reach their goals. For example, people who imagined having a great week at work ended up doing less.

Psychologist Carol Dweck talks about how our beliefs about ability affect how we feel about failure. Some people think ability is something you are born with, while others believe it can grow with effort and challenges. People who think ability is fixed feel very bad about failing. For example, a sports star who thinks he is a natural talent may not practice enough and then fail. On the other hand, people who believe ability can grow see failure as a chance to learn and improve. Dweck compares this to weight training, where muscles get stronger by being pushed to their limits. Having a growth mindset can make people happier, whether or not they succeed.

Text: 

Everyone knows that sports teams usually do better when they play at home. But why is this? Many people think they know the answer, but things in professional sports are changing quickly. Two main reasons make us question the idea of home advantage: science and money. 

Sports scientists want to understand what helps players do their best. They have many ideas about home advantage. At the same time, people who invest money in sports want to know why home advantage is important. They think that if players are paid enough, they should feel good playing anywhere.

What about the fans? Would it matter if a team like Manchester United played some games far away, in places like the Far East, to reach more fans? It would matter to British fans who believe their team needs their support and energy. Fans often think that if they cheer loudly, their team will score. They remember the times when they cheered and a goal was scored, but they forget the times when their cheering did not help.

One thing that fans believe is supported by science. Home fans not only cheer for their team but also shout at the referee. In a study, referees watched a game with crowd noise and another game without noise. The referees who heard the crowd were less likely to call fouls against the home team. This means that referees try to avoid making calls that would upset the home crowd.

Recent studies show that home advantage has become less important in many sports, but not as much as we might think. For example, in the early days of the Football League in England, home teams won about 70% of the time. Today, they win about 60% of the time. One reason for this change is travel. Now, players travel in comfort, and if their hotel is not good, the team will find them a better one. 

Also, stadiums today look very similar and are very efficient. However, these changes happened only in the last few years. The mystery remains: why does home advantage change from sport to sport? Basketball has the most home advantage, followed by football. Baseball has the least home advantage. This might be because baseball is more about individual players, while team sports like basketball depend on teamwork. 

In basketball, players feel more confident when they play at home, which helps them work better together. There is also another interesting finding. Researchers found that players have higher testosterone levels before home games. This might be because they want to protect their home ground. 

In some recent games, underdog teams won at home against stronger teams. They showed great determination and did not let the other team intimidate them. As one referee said, "It’s the law of the jungle out there."

Text: "Gary Player, a famous golfer, once said, 'The more I practice, the luckier I get.' This saying is popular among many athletes and their coaches. It means that practicing helps you get better at something. 

There is a big question about whether talent is something you are born with or something you can learn. Many people believe that practice is more important than natural talent. Psychologist Anders Ericsson said that to become an expert in anything, you need to practice for 10,000 hours. This idea is in many books, like Malcolm Gladwell’s Outliers, which say that practice is the key to success.

However, author Epstein thinks this idea is not always true. He points out that many studies focus only on very successful people. He asks if there are other reasons why some people are good at things and others are not. He travels around the world to find answers, from Kenya to Sweden and even to Alaska. In Alaska, he learns that the drive of sled dogs might come from their genes, not just their training.

Epstein talks about two important ideas: 'hardware' (which is nature, like genes) and 'software' (which is nurture, like training and environment). He believes both are important for top athletes. For example, if Usain Bolt had grown up in the US, he might have been a good basketball player instead of the fastest runner in the world.

Epstein also discusses race and gender in sports. He asks why we have separate competitions for men and women if practice is the only thing that matters. Sometimes, the best questions are the simplest ones."

A recent report says that many children in rich countries feel lonely and unhappy. Jay Griffiths asks why children today are not happy. In her new book, Kith, she explains that many children stay inside too much. They spend a lot of time in front of screens, like TVs and computers, and they do not play outside in nature anymore. Griffiths believes this is a big problem.

A follow-up study talked to some children to understand their feelings better. Many of them said they would be happier if they could go outside more. Older people often remember their childhoods fondly. They talk about how they played outside, explored, and had fun in nature. They think this was better than how children live today. However, they forget that they are the ones who keep their children safe and do not let them play outside as much.

Griffiths discusses how parents worry about dangers outside. This worry makes them keep their children at home, which helps toy and gadget companies sell more products to keep kids entertained. She also talks about how some children are given medicine for being restless or how they have to wear goggles to play games. 

Griffiths is passionate about children’s freedom to play and explore. However, some of her ideas go too far. She sometimes compares how we treat children today to racism, which seems extreme. She believes children should be allowed to explore and take risks. She says that children need to have small accidents to learn how to be safe later. But she does not explain how to let children have these small accidents safely.

Not all children want to play outside or take risks. Some children are shy or prefer to stay at home. Maybe the real problem is that we try to make all children act the same way, whether we keep them inside or push them outside.

I am a bio-psychologist and I have studied a lot. I am good at solving problems in my work and life, but this is not just because of my education. Many problems in life cannot be solved with formulas or answers we learn in school. They need judgment, wisdom, and creativity that come from life experiences. For children, these experiences happen during play.

My recent research is about how important play is for children’s growth. All young animals, including humans, play. Animals that need to learn more play the most. For example, meat-eating animals play more than plant-eating animals because hunting is harder to learn than eating grass. Primates, like monkeys, play more than other animals because they need to learn more.

Children play a lot because they have much to learn. Play helps children learn important skills that they cannot learn in school. These skills include thinking creatively, getting along with others, and controlling their feelings. Creativity is very important for success in life. We need people who can ask new questions and solve new problems, not just follow instructions.

Great thinkers, like Albert Einstein, often keep their playful minds as adults. Einstein said that school almost made him lose interest in math and science, but he found it again after school. He called his creative work “combinatorial play.” He imagined chasing a sunbeam and thought about what would happen.

We cannot teach creativity, but school can sometimes take it away. School often focuses on answers that are already known, instead of letting children ask their own questions. It is also very important for children to learn how to get along with others and care for them. Children naturally want to play with each other, and through play, they learn social skills and fairness.

Play is voluntary, which means children can stop playing whenever they want. If they cannot stop, it is not really play. Players know they must keep each other happy to keep the game going. Play is a very free activity.

However, school has become harder. There are fewer breaks, more homework, and more pressure for good grades. Outside of school, organized sports have taken the place of free play. Adults now often supervise playdates instead of letting children play freely in their neighborhoods. This has changed slowly over time, but it has been a big change. Parents worry more, and experts warn about dangers. Many believe children learn better from adults than from each other.

Our children do not need more school. They need more play. If we care about our children and the future, we must change this trend. We need to let children play and explore so they can grow into strong adults ready for the future.

In many countries, more young people in their twenties are using social media to find jobs. Websites like Twitter and LinkedIn help them connect directly with employers. This is easier than before when people had to stand outside offices with signs saying "hire me." But using social media can also lead to mistakes.

For example, a young man in the US tried to contact a senior marketing executive on LinkedIn. He thought she could help him because she knew many important people. However, she was upset that he asked her to share her contacts. She rejected his request and sent a rude message that many people saw online. This made others think about how to use social media for work. 

Social media can be risky for job seekers who do not know how to use it properly. Many young people have used sites like Facebook and Twitter for fun, but using them for work is different. When I was a teenager, social media was a way to escape from parents and teachers. It was a place to show off and be creative. You could talk to someone online for hours and then ignore them at school. You could also change how you looked online with pictures and songs.

However, using social media for work is not the same. Some young people still act like they did when they were teenagers. Just because many people liked your posts on Facebook does not mean you will impress employers on LinkedIn. We need to understand that the rules have changed, and we must meet employers' expectations to get jobs.

One common complaint from employers is that young job seekers are too casual and seem arrogant. This makes older people think badly of our generation. In reality, many young people are struggling to find jobs, which is why they use social media. This impression of arrogance can hurt their chances, even if they have the skills to do well at work.

So, how should you contact someone on a professional site? First, clearly say who you are and explain how you can help them. This way, you have a better chance of getting a good response. Avoid sending the same message to many people, and keep your tone polite. Remember, social media can help you make important connections, but you need to use it carefully to avoid problems.

It is hard to say what will happen to newspapers in the future. Many people think newspapers are in trouble. Since 2000, the number of people reading UK national newspapers has dropped a lot, by about one-third to one-half. In the USA, a study shows that only 26% of people get their news from newspapers now, down from 45% in 2001. Some people believe that printed newspapers will disappear in 15 years. 

However, history shows that old forms of media often survive. For example, in 1835, a journalist said that books and theaters would not be popular anymore, but theaters are still here today. Radio is still popular even with television. Movies are still enjoyed, even with videos and DVDs. Even vinyl records are coming back, with online sales increasing a lot since 2008. 

Newspapers were once a new form of media too. It took a long time for them to become the main way people got news. This happened because it became easier to share news with many people thanks to new technology in the 19th century. People also started to think that the world is always changing and they wanted to know what was happening. In the past, people only noticed changes with the seasons or big events like floods or diseases. 

Before the 19th century, journalism was not a job that many people could do for a living. Most people did not feel they needed news every day or week. Newspapers have a regular schedule, which can be a problem. Now, with the internet, people can read news whenever they want. They can also choose what news is important to them. Online news can be updated quickly, and mistakes can be fixed right away. 

However, many news providers focus on being the first to share news instead of helping people understand it. In the past, news was shared in busy places like markets or taverns, where truth and rumors mixed together. Today, it seems like we are going back to that way of sharing news. Newspapers have not always done a good job of explaining how the world works. They might disappear, or they might find a way to help us understand better in this confusing world.

Humans are used to living in the light of the sun. We are not like many animals that are active at night. These animals feel comfortable in the dark. But we have changed the night by adding a lot of artificial light. This is called light pollution. 

Light pollution happens because of bad lighting design. Instead of shining light down where we need it, lights often shine up into the sky. This bright light changes the darkness of night. Many animals, including us, have adapted to the natural light and dark cycles. When we add too much light, it can affect their lives. For example, it can change how they migrate, reproduce, and find food.

A long time ago, in the year 1800, people in London used candles and lanterns. There were not many lights in the streets. If you walked towards London at night, you would smell the city before you saw its dim light. 

Now, we have bright lights everywhere, but many animals are still active at night. Some birds are attracted to bright lights and can get lost or hurt. They may fly around lights until they fall. Other birds sing at strange times because of artificial light.

Light pollution was thought to only bother astronomers who study stars. But all living things need darkness. Without it, our bodies do not work well. Our sleep and wake cycles are important for our health. Changing these cycles can cause problems for us.

In the end, light pollution affects us just like it affects animals. We have lost our connection to nature and the night sky. We forget how small we are in the universe when we cannot see the stars and the Milky Way above us.

A founder of a big company said that his business will not keep track of how much holiday time employees take. He got this idea from another internet company that has a similar rule. The founder said he was inspired by a happy email from his daughter. 

This new rule might not work well for a big company. The internet company has 2,000 workers and does one job, but the big company has 50,000 workers and does many different jobs like finance, transport, and healthcare. The idea of taking as much time off as you want might be better for a smaller company where workers know each other’s jobs well. 

The founder said employees can take as much leave as they want, but they must be sure that their work is done and that their absence will not hurt the business or their careers. But is it really possible to be so sure? When you come back from holiday, there is always a lot of work waiting for you. 

If workers feel guilty about taking time off, they might not take any leave at all. This can lead to stress and lower productivity. There can also be pressure from coworkers about who is taking time off and for how long. In many companies, workers feel they must work late, which can make them feel they cannot take holidays, especially if they want to get promoted. 

Without the legal right to take holidays, workers might feel they cannot take time off because they do not want to seem lazy. This could make them feel stuck and not able to take their holidays. 

Modern technology makes it hard to separate work time from free time. The internet company started their unlimited leave policy because employees wanted to know how to balance work and time off. But if there are no set working hours, workers might feel they are always being watched by their employer. 

Employment laws exist to protect workers. They have the right to take a certain amount of paid holiday because rest is important for their health. The benefits of unlimited leave, like better morale and creativity, can happen without harming worker well-being. So, I am not sure if this new holiday policy will really help workers take the time off they need.

Peer review is a process where experts check a scientific research paper before it is published. This process is important because it helps to make sure that only good quality papers are published. However, reviewing a paper can take a long time, sometimes up to a year. Some people wonder if this delay is worth it.

Many scientists still believe in peer review, but there are changes happening in how research is published. One change is the use of preprints. Preprints are drafts of papers that are shared online before they are reviewed. This allows other scientists to read and discuss the new research quickly. 

Publishing in journals has become very competitive. Scientists want to publish in well-known journals to help their careers. This can sometimes lead to problems, like researchers leaving out important information to make their papers look better. Reviewers may also focus more on whether a paper is good enough for a specific journal rather than if it is good science.

Some scientists are starting to use preprints more. They believe preprints can help solve some problems in the current system. However, not all scientists are ready to use preprints because they worry that journals will not accept papers that have been shared online first. There is also a fear that publishing without peer review could lead to bad science, but this has not happened yet.

A psychology professor named Tanya Elks shared her experience with preprints. She wrote a paper that criticized another published paper. In the traditional system, the authors of the original paper could block her critique. But with preprints, both sides could share their views openly. This way, readers can see all the arguments and decide for themselves.

Preprint archives allow scientists from around the world to discuss their work informally. They can also share negative results, which are often ignored by journals that focus only on new discoveries. Papers shared as preprints are read and cited more often, showing that this method works well for sharing research. 

By using preprints, scientists can focus more on the quality of their work rather than where it is published.

When I ask my students what a poem is, they often say it is "a painting in words." But this answer does not make me or them happy. One day, I asked my students to pick an object and write about it in two ways. First, they had to describe it like a scientist. Then, they had to write from the object's point of view and call it "Poem." One student wrote: 

"Poem
I may look strange or scary, but I help people breathe. I am used only in emergencies and for a short time. Most people will never need me." 

The object was an oxygen mask. This choice helped the class understand how poetry works in a special way. The exercise was fun and led to good discussions.

When I was in school, I found poetry confusing. I thought every poem was a silly puzzle that made it hard to understand feelings. After school, many people pay less attention to poetry. Sometimes, you see a poem, and it stands out because it is not like regular writing. It challenges you to read it, but often you feel let down because it is not exciting or hard to understand.

What do we want from poems? We might think a poem should show deep feelings, beautiful images, or clever thoughts. But if we want tears, we watch movies. If we want information, we read articles. Novels take us to new worlds, and music is hard to beat with its mix of words and sounds. 

However, poems can show us something special: ambiguity, or uncertainty. Life is full of this, unlike reading sentences one by one. But this does not really explain what a poem is. If you look up "poem" online, it leads you to "poetry," which is described as a type of art that uses the beauty and rhythm of language. This is fancy language, but it does not explain the word's roots. "Poem" comes from the Greek word "poí?ma," which means "a thing made," and a poet is "a maker of things." 

So, if a poem is a thing made, what kind of thing is it? Some poets say poems are like wild animals – hard to control and unpredictable – or like machines – made by humans and exact. But these comparisons do not always work. The best part of trying to define a poem through comparison is the discussion it creates. Whether you see a poem as a machine or a wild animal, this can change how you think about both. It can help you see everyday things in a new way.

A poem is not hard to understand, especially when we think about how song lyrics can stick in our minds. The mix of words and music is powerful, just like the saying, "Sticks and stones may break my bones, but words can never hurt me." But sometimes, words can hurt, just like sticks and stones. 

Think about a poem in a newspaper or magazine. A poem can touch you like nothing else, even though it is just ink on paper, like the articles around it. Why is there empty space around the poem? This space could be used for a longer article or an ad. A poem is written and rewritten like any article or story, but it is not made to be sold. Publishers send out poetry collections, but they do not expect to make money from them. A poem is not just for the market; it is special for its own sake. Because of this, a poem can still surprise us, even if just for a moment.

I bought my first metal detector after I got married. It cost £70, which was a lot of money at that time. My wife, Marion, was very impressed when I found a gold ring worth £80 on my first trip. Over the years, I have found many things like brooches and coins, and it always makes me happy. I like feeling connected to the past. 

After the gold ring, it took 40 years before I found something that impressed Marion again. One dull February afternoon, I had some free time and a place to search. It was raining, so I chose a closer spot where I knew there were old farming tools. When my detector beeped for the first time, I found a piece of a metal wheel. Then it beeped again. I tried to ignore it, but I had to see what it was. I dug down half a meter and lay in the mud when I saw a round, golden ball. 

I had found brass curtain rails before, so I was careful not to get too excited. But as I cleaned it, I saw it was a beautiful, thick loop. I remembered seeing something like it in the British Museum. It was called a torc, a famous necklace from over 2,000 years ago. It is made of gold and silver and has a twist design. I took it to my car and looked at it all the way home. 

When I got home, I washed it in the sink. I shouted for Marion, saying I had something for her. She came in and asked what it was. I told her it was a very old and rare piece of jewelry. We didn’t try it on because we didn’t want to damage it. At night, I hid it in our wardrobe. I was worried about it being stolen, so I later hid it under a floorboard in my office.

The law says I must tell the authorities about such finds within 14 days. I wanted to enjoy the torc as much as I could before I reported it. I even took it in a plastic bag to show a friend in the hospital. Finally, I took it to the council office. The registrar was busy talking to someone when I put the torc on his desk. He stopped talking when he saw it. 

The torc was confirmed as real and was sold to my local council. Now, it is in the British Museum in London. I received £350,000, which I shared with the owner of the field where I found it. But the torc is more than just money for me. It is something I have saved for everyone. People ask if I will stop using my metal detector now that I found something so amazing. But I still find brooches and coins interesting. Just like a fisherman who catches a big fish, I will keep searching for more treasures.

Sleeping is one of my favorite things about traveling, but I don’t talk about it much because I feel a bit guilty. When my friends tell me about their busy trips with many activities like visiting museums and hiking, I just smile and don’t say much. What would they think if they knew I like to take naps in the afternoon and sleep in on beautiful mornings? Sleeping better is one good thing about traveling. 

When I went to Mexico’s Yucatán coast in my early 20s, I was surprised that I slept more than 12 hours most days. There were loud birds nearby, but it didn’t bother me. Far from home, I could sleep deeply and have nice dreams. Without alarm clocks and responsibilities, I found it easier to sleep. 

I think sleep is part of traveling, not just a break from it. When we travel, we see, hear, and smell new things. All these new experiences fill our minds, and when we sleep, we process them. That’s why sleep feels different when we travel. 

People often worry about jet lag, but I think the trouble I have after long trips is more about getting used to new places than just time changes. For example, in Trinidad, people wake up very early to avoid the heat, then they rest when the sun is high, and they become active again in the cool evening. Even though Trinidad is only one hour ahead of New York, it takes me days to get used to their sleep schedule. When I finally do, I feel like I belong there.

I remember one afternoon in Santo Domingo, the capital of the Dominican Republic. I had a big lunch with new friends in an apartment with a view of the blue Caribbean Sea. After eating, we all felt sleepy and started to relax. One by one, my friends went to lie down on hammocks and sofas. I understood why they had so many pillows. I took some pillows too and joined them. I had heard about the siesta, a nap in the afternoon, but that day I really experienced it. I shared not just sleep, but a part of Dominican life.

Travel sleep is special because I remember it. In a new place, I enjoy the different smells, textures, and sounds while I sleep. If enjoying every moment of travel is what makes a good traveler today, then sleeping is one of the best ways to do that. Maybe I should not feel embarrassed about my love for sleep and tell my friends that sleeping while traveling is an important part of the experience too.

The woman looked at herself in the mirror and asked, "What do you think? Be honest." Mia, the shop assistant, picked up a nice hat with a soft layer of fabric and a silk bow. "I think this one looks best on you," she said politely. The woman made a funny face and said, "But it is so boring. Every other woman will wear a hat like that at my daughter’s wedding. This pretty little hat will make me stand out." She touched the small red and black top hat on her head and said, "Yes, this is the one I want." 

Mia smiled and agreed that the woman would stand out at the wedding. She thought about her own daughter, Jen, who was turning thirty today. They were having a family party, and Mia was excited to see Jen, Dan, and Luke. She was also curious about Jen's friend, Tattie, who they did not know. Mia's husband, Jeff, had joked about the name when Jen called to ask if she could bring Tattie. "What kind of name is that?" he had said. Mia replied, "It’s short for Tatiana. I think it’s nice." Jeff did not like fancy names and often said Mia was too polite. He would have told the woman in the shop that she was choosing the wrong hat.

After an hour, Mia closed her shop and went home. It took her only forty seconds to get there. Four years ago, when Luke left home, Mia decided to turn an old barn into a shop for her hat business. Jeff was not sure it would work. "Do you really think people want hats?" he asked. But Mia knew many women had trouble finding the right hat for special occasions. She was right. From the first day, after Jen helped her make a website, Mia’s Hats became popular. Women came from far away to try on hats in her shop in Little Pelham. She made sure they felt comfortable and encouraged them to bring their outfits to find the perfect match. Recently, she also started selling handbags and jewelry.

Lawrence Okoye has moved from London to Atlanta, and he is thinking about his amazing sports journey. He is confident but surprised by how far he has come. He went from being in the Olympic final for discus throwing to possibly playing American football, even though he has never played it before. 

Lawrence is learning about his new position in football. It is surprising that a 21-year-old from London could be chosen for a big American football team. But Lawrence is good at surprising people. He was offered a place at Oxford University to study law, but he decided to train seriously for discus throwing instead. In just 20 months, he became the fourth-best discus thrower in the world.

Lawrence came to Atlanta to train for the world championships in discus. He thought about American football but only decided to try it when he got to the USA. After arriving, he saw that there were trials for the NFL in Atlanta. Even though he had never played football, he applied to attend the trials. 

When asked if he was nervous about being tested with experienced players, he said no. He is confident in his abilities. His performance in tests showed that he was the best player. He felt proud when he heard this. However, he knows he has no experience in football. He believes that if he works hard, he can succeed.

Lawrence is calm while waiting to hear if he has been selected for a team. He is not worried, even though many people think he will be chosen. This calmness may come from his experience in the Olympic final, where he did not do well. He has moved on from that and is happy that he made it to the final.

The minimum salary for an NFL player is over $400,000 a year, which is a big reason for Lawrence to try football. He has changed from rugby to athletics and now to American football. Some people think he should focus on just one sport, but Lawrence wants to achieve his dreams. If football does not work out, he can always go back to discus throwing, which he loves. He believes every choice he has made is a good one.

I woke up on a plane flying east. It was already morning, and I looked out the window. Below me, I saw a big empty land with dark brown and green colors. It was mid-September, but it still looked like summer in Siberia. I could not see any people, just mountains, rivers, and forests going far away.

My neighbor, Sergei, woke up and smiled at me. “Good morning, Robert,” he said with a slow Russian accent. Sergei was a salesman from Moscow. He was going to sell safety clothes to people who work in mines. His English was not very good, and my Russian was not good either. But I used a dictionary to tell him I was going to Magadan, a city in far-eastern Siberia. I had a one-way ticket because I wanted to ride my bicycle back to England.

“But, Robert,” he said, “there is no road from Magadan. You cannot ride a bicycle.” I told him I thought there was a road, but not many people used it. “Alone?” he asked, pointing at me. “No, I will ride with a friend named Al.” “Just one friend?” he asked. “Yes, just one,” I nodded. Sergei still looked worried and pointed outside, saying “Holodna” (cold). I tried to show him with my hands that I had warm clothes, but I didn’t tell him I was on a tight budget. Most of my clothes were cheap. I was not sure if they would keep me warm, especially my big over-trousers that I bought for £10.

This adventure started in a lecture hall in Scotland. The hall was full of tired students. The teacher was talking, and I was thinking about something important. Should I ask my friend Al to go on a bike trip? I decided to write him a note: “Hi Al, Do you want to cycle across the Karakorum Highway between Pakistan and China this summer? Rob.” I passed the note to Al, who was sitting in front of me. He read it, thought for a moment, and wrote back, “OK.”

Now, six years later, I was going to meet Al in Siberia. I had been working as a geography teacher. The job was hard, but I liked it. I had long holidays to go on adventures. I visited Al twice during these holidays. After our bike ride in Pakistan, Al wanted to travel more. He decided to cycle around the world. He was taking on bigger challenges every time. This trip around the world was his biggest challenge yet. Sometimes he thought it was too hard, but I admired him. He was having an amazing adventure and facing new challenges every day. He was proving to everyone that he could do it, and it made him feel alive.

In The Red Bull Air Race, twelve pilots race through tall pylons that are between 15 and 25 metres high. They make sharp turns and do tricks at speeds of up to 370 km per hour. I was invited to experience this race. 

An hour before my flight, I had to sign two forms. The first form said I was healthy, and the second said I would empty my pockets. Small objects can be dangerous during the flight. I learned that I needed to stay focused. I was told, “The horizon is your best friend,” and the pilot would tell me where to look. I also promised to relax and enjoy the view when flying upside down.

Half an hour before the flight, I had a safety talk. I was told not to touch anything. When we started moving on the runway, I was nervous. My legs were up, and I tried not to touch the important pedals and switches. I knew I had to stay calm to survive the flight. 

Dario, the pilot, and I were in a very fast acrobatic plane called the Zivko Edge 540. The plane took off, and two seconds later, we turned sharply to the right. I felt the air push out of my lungs. I looked at the horizon and tensed my body. For a moment, I felt much heavier than normal. Then we leveled out and turned left, diving down. 

We flew very close to the ground, going 400 km per hour. I was allowed to fly the plane for two minutes, but my hand was shaking. Dario then did a barrel roll, which is a full turn in the air. I was surprised but said I was okay. Then he did a loop, flying upside down. 

Many people would find this fun, like riding a rollercoaster, but I thought it was too much. At the top of the loop, I heard a voice saying, “Relax, relax, look up.” I looked up and saw fields. The flight lasted 10 minutes. It was easier than what the pilots usually do in the race. When we landed, Dario ate sandwiches, but I couldn’t eat for hours. That night, I dreamed about flying upside down again.

Doug Allan films wild animals in cold places. If you have seen polar bears in a nature documentary, it is likely that he filmed them. He likes the cold temperature of -18C. Allan studied marine biology and was a commercial diver. Diving was his first love, and he learned how to survive in cold places. His big chance came when a TV crew came to Antarctica, where he was working, to make a wildlife documentary. He helped the crew find different places to film. After 48 hours, he realized that being a wildlife cameraman was perfect for him because it included travel, adventure, and underwater filming.

Now, he is a famous cameraman and has worked on many important TV wildlife shows. When he started 35 years ago, not many people had been to Antarctica. There were people who filmed coral, elephants, and chimpanzees, but he became known as the "cold man." He felt that many amazing scenes were waiting to be filmed. 

When he began, the camera and technology were very simple. He said, "It is easier to film today. In the past, if you filmed something, you had to remember it. Now, with digital cameras, you can see what you filmed right away." He explained that in the past, filming was expensive, so you had to be careful about what you shot. 

Allan has a lot of experience in cold places. He feels comfortable on sea ice, like it is crossing the street. He does get cold toes, but he says the poles are healthy places because there are no leeches, diseases, or mosquitoes. 

Wildlife filming has many successes, but also failures. Once, he was in the Orkneys to film kittiwakes, but he could not tell which birds they were. Recently, he got permission to film in Kong Karls Land, a group of islands in the Arctic Ocean. This place is home to polar bears and is very dangerous. In April, it is usually -32C, and the wind is strong. Carrying cameras in deep snow is very hard. After walking for five hours a day and watching polar bear dens for 23 days, he only saw one mother bear and her cub. 

On the 24th day, he felt like he was part of the bear world. He waited by a hole in the snow. After a long time, he saw a black nose, then a bear's head. The bear came out and rested in front of him. She looked at him but did not care. Then, she slid down the slope, and two cubs appeared at the den entrance. Allan felt excited because it was their first time seeing the world.

Now, Allan wants to make his own film about climate change in the Arctic. He wants to talk to the people who live there and see how it affects their lives. He believes he can make an amazing documentary.

In 2004, Pen Hadow was the first person to walk to the North Pole alone without getting more supplies. He had to swim in very cold water, fight frostbite, and deal with polar bears. Eight months later, he also reached the South Pole. Now, he is back in the Arctic, getting ready for a new adventure that is even bigger. 

Pen and two friends will go on a three-month journey of 1,000 kilometers to the North Pole. They will measure the ice to see how thick and dense it is. No one has done this before, and the information will be very important for scientists. This will help us understand how global warming is affecting the ice in the polar areas.

When he was a child, Pen was raised by a woman who worked for a famous polar explorer. She made him tough by sending him outside in bad weather with few clothes. His father also loved adventures in cold places, and Pen became very strong. 

Pen is married to Mary, who loves horses. She helps him with his polar guide business. Mary says she worries more about him when he is at home because he thinks about the Arctic. For fun, she once raced against him in a mountain event, and she finished an hour before him. 

Pen and Mary live in the countryside with their two children. He finds it harder to be away from them this time. When he last left, his son was only one year old, and he told him to take care of his mother and sister. This made his son very worried. Pen feels it was not fair to put that on him. This time, he plans to have little contact with his family while he is in the Arctic because he does not want to remind them how far away he is.

Before he leaves, Pen is getting ready and checking his equipment carefully. He knows that on the ice, it is hard to fix things. He will be with Ann Daniels, a top polar explorer, and Martin Hartley, a photographer. They will have a team of six people to help them with supplies.

Pen is feeling some stress because he is turning 47 soon and has not trained as much as he wanted. He thinks that his mission is important because it will help scientists learn more about the Arctic Ocean. He believes that their skills are now very useful for society.

I took a year off. I thought about what to do. Being an Olympian is special. I had time to write, work on TV, and talk to businesses and schools. I enjoyed these activities, but I wanted to compete again. I wanted to stay fit in case I wanted to try for the Olympics again. So, I joined marathons and triathlons. 

But then, I remembered Ben Fogle, a TV presenter. He asked me, “Do you want to row across the Atlantic with me?” I love rowing and missed it. But I wasn’t ready to train every day. Still, I wanted some competition. I asked my rowing friends if they wanted to join the race, but they were not interested. I knew that if I joined the race, I would want to win. But rowing with Ben might not give me the best chance to win. On the other hand, being an underdog without pressure sounded nice.

I contacted Ben. He was going to join the race anyway and had found the money for the entry fee and a boat. This made the race feel real. We talked about the costs; the boat and equipment would cost £70,000, which is a lot of money. We thought we had a good chance, but we still needed to work hard to get it. I also had to think about losing money because I would be away from home. Speaking at business events is a good way to earn money after being a professional athlete. It feels nice that people want to hear from me. But I find it hard to talk about my past without a new goal. 

Joining the race would mean I was doing something again, not just talking about what I did before. I learned a lot while planning this adventure. One big lesson was to appreciate the easy life of a full-time athlete. Training for the Olympics was hard, but it was simple. I trained almost every day, but I had a set plan and support from doctors and dieticians. 

I was worried about what people would think of me racing with a TV presenter. I thought it might look like I just wanted to be on TV. But as we prepared, my worries went away. The Atlantic Rowing Race is not just about rowing; it is also about the mind. Ben had done tough challenges before, but he didn’t know how to row. I was surprised by how little he understood about rowing, and he was surprised by my honesty. I could have been more patient, but I needed to tell him how much he needed to improve. I should have known what to expect when I agreed to race with him.

A little over a year ago, I left my job to work with huskies in the Arctic Circle in northern Finland. I was 26 years old and wanted a change. I dreamed of cold, snowy landscapes because I was tired of the busy life in London. I found a small company run by Anna McCormack and her husband, Pasi Ikonen, in Finnish Lapland. They hired me as a husky dog handler for the winter season. From December to February, they take many tourists on sled rides pulled by huskies across the snow. They started with six dogs, but now they have more than 100. They also took over a second place called the 'wilderness farm,' which is pretty but basic, with bad electricity and no running water. They told me I could join the team for three months, but the work would be hard. I started packing right away.

On November 6, I flew from London. I looked at a page with pictures of more than 100 huskies. I was supposed to remember their names, but I felt nervous. I put the page down and looked out the window. I thought about how spring moves north, but I saw winter coming south, with rivers freezing.

On November 7, I took a bus north. The ride was beautiful. We drove through dark forests with snow on the trees and stopped for reindeer. I arrived at the farm after dark. As soon as I got in, Anna gave me a pair of boots and sent me outside into the cold. She asked if I wanted to start working right away. I followed the sound of barking and found the dogs. Three people were running around, getting the huskies ready for sleds. The dogs were very excited and wanted to go. I tried to introduce myself, but everyone was too busy. I petted one of the quieter dogs. Then someone told me to get in the sled, and I almost fell in. A command was given, and we took off into the dark with only a headlamp for light.

By November 15, I was learning how to be a husky guide, but first, Anna asked me if I was useful. I didn’t know how to answer. I had never driven a snowmobile, done woodwork, or used an axe. But when someone asked if I had a driving license, I nodded, feeling relieved. I learned the basics of dog-sledding quickly: lean into the corners, use both feet to stop, and hold on to the handlebar. But other tasks were hard. Feeding and watering the dogs was difficult in the freezing cold. Water would freeze quickly, so we made a 'soup' of meat in hot water for the dogs. By the end of my first week, I was tired and my muscles hurt from pulling heavy sleds and being pulled by excited huskies. But I felt proud. I emailed my friends, saying, "I can chop with an axe, hammer a nail, and use a saw. In the snow!"

On that day, Radcliffe ran very fast and crossed the finish line. Many reporters came to talk to her about her amazing run. They said her time was good enough to compete in the men's marathon at the world championships in Paris. The journalists asked her about emu oil, a special treatment that helped her heal after she had an accident while training. Radcliffe said she did not fully understand how big her achievement was at that moment. She thought it was just what she was supposed to do that day. She and her team believed in having no limits.

During the race, her husband Gary Lough and her physiotherapist Gerard Hartmann were in a car, listening to the race on the radio. After 16 kilometers, Radcliffe's agent worried that she might not keep up her fast pace. Hartmann was angry about this because he knew how fit she was. With 800 meters left, Radcliffe realized she could finish in under 2 hours and 16 minutes if she ran fast. She had already run 41 kilometers quickly, and she finished the last part in 2 minutes and 25 seconds. At the end, she thought, "I can run faster than that." The race director, Dave Bedford, said he never thought anyone would run that fast for a long time. Radcliffe thought she would come back and do it again next year, but that did not happen.

After the race, everyone wanted to know how Radcliffe, who ran in a strange way, beat the skilled East African runners. Hartmann worked with her a lot, helping her with her training. He said he had worked with many Olympic winners, but Radcliffe could handle more pain than anyone else. He often traveled 13 hours from Ireland to help her train. When he arrived, her husband would say, "Gerard, you're 15 minutes late, Paula's waiting." There was no time for small talk; Radcliffe wanted to start training right away. Hartmann spent so much time with her that other athletes became jealous.

Radcliffe was asked why no one has come close to her record. She said she trained very hard, but there are other talented runners. She thought Mary Keitany, a two-time London marathon winner, could do it. Radcliffe believed that some runners focus more on beating others than on improving themselves. She always pushed herself to run hard, even when she was winning. Radcliffe did not know it at the time, but that marathon was the best she would ever run. However, she inspired many women to start long-distance running.

When my first cooking show, In Search of Perfection, started, I was not sure how people would like it. There was a lot of talk about a food ‘revolution’ in Britain, and I thought we made a good show that was different. But I worried: would people like a show about cooking that included history and science? I watched the first episode with both joy and fear. I didn’t need to worry. The show became very popular and led to many other interesting projects, including a book about my restaurant. 

In each project, I felt like I was on a journey, whether it was into the past or learning new cooking techniques. I wrote several books in a series called ‘Perfection’, each one with its own TV show. In these books, I traveled to many places and met amazing people, like a man who makes special pasta that tastes great. These people have spent many years trying to reach their own idea of perfection. 

Perfection means different things to different people. Choosing which dishes to include in the show was hard, and I knew some people would be upset if their favorite dish was not there. I could imagine people asking, “Where is steak and kidney pie and bread and butter pudding?” But after a long meeting, my team and I made a list that included something for everyone. This showed me that everyone has their own idea of perfection based on their feelings and memories.

Even though the book is called ‘Perfection’, I knew I could not say the recipes were the best. I believed that by using my cooking skills and talking to food makers and chefs, I could find out what makes these dishes special. The dictionary says ‘perfection’ means being perfect, but it also means trying new ideas and improving them until they are unique. 

The TV show let me explore many foods, people, and places I had never seen before. I was excited to learn about food and memories because I started my career in the same way. Finding the best ingredients took me around the world. I had many adventures, like visiting a factory that was using the wrong tomatoes and a dairy farm that was not good enough for filming. I even tried to make ice cream by hand-milking a cow and using dry ice, cooked chicken in a hospital machine, and almost burned my house while trying to make a real Neapolitan pizza.

We were still far from Marrakech when the van made a loud noise, went off the road into a field, and stopped. John got out and opened the front of the van. He looked at the engine for a long time with his hands in his pockets. He looked like he knew what he was doing. But then he said, “Actually, I don’t know what I’m doing,” and he and Mum started to laugh. Bea was worried. “We can’t stay here forever,” she said. The field was big and had only grass and many flowers, like poppies and daisies. “No, we can’t stay here forever,” I said too, because it was better to agree with Bea. We got back into the van and waited for Mum and John to stop laughing. We watched John get smaller as he walked to find someone who could help with the van. Mum lay down on the grass. “Tell us a story,” she said. Bea lay down next to her. “Go on, tell us a story.” So I told them about how the day before we left London, I heard two birds talking. I told them what the birds talked about: breadcrumbs, other birds, the weather, and an argument over a worm. “That’s silly, no one understands bird language,” Bea said. My eyes felt wet. “I do.” But I didn’t sound sure. “Liar,” Bea said. I felt embarrassed. How could I be lying if I remembered everything? I thought about asking Mum, but she had fallen asleep in the sun. 

John came back with three Moroccan boys who helped us push the van to the hotel. Bea didn’t want to get out. The boys waved and smiled at her through the back windows. We followed John into a café. It was not far from where our van was parked. “It’s a hotel,” John whispered. “It might be a bit expensive.” “We’ll just have some tea,” Mum said, and we sat in the shade. The tea was made from mint leaves and was very sweet. Mum looked into the pot. “It’s like syrup,” she said. We stayed at the café all day while John looked at the engine. “It’s a miracle it got us this far,” he said when it started to get dark. Mum took out blankets and made a bed for us in the hotel garden. It felt nice to sleep on the ground. “I’ll have to get us towed into Marrakech,” John said. 

Half an hour later, we were in a truck watching our van being pulled behind it with John driving. At first, Bea didn’t want to move, so John picked her up and put her in the truck. Now she sat in the front with the driver. I kept thinking about how we would get home now that our van had to be pulled everywhere. I thought it might be easier to take a boat straight to London. Then I must have fallen asleep.

Lucy was at a welcome party in a hotel ballroom. She was talking to two other pianists who were also at the Prague Classical Music Festival. One was a guy from Tokyo, and the other was a girl from Europe named Liesel or Louisa. They were both older than Lucy by about ten years. They spoke good English and talked about the music they were playing and their travels. 

“I think I’m going to Tanglewood this summer,” Lucy said. It sounded impressive, but she didn’t really want to go. She didn’t want to do many things that took her away from school, like concerts and competitions. Because of this, she wasn’t officially enrolled in school anymore. Instead, she worked with tutors from the University of San Francisco. 

Lucy didn’t even want to come to the Prague Festival, which only took fifteen young pianists from around the world. She was lucky to be chosen from thousands of applicants. At the party, her dad gave her a white-gold necklace with an L pendant to celebrate. Her little brother Gus dreamed about being at the festival one day. Lucy’s teacher, Grace Chang, took her out for a special dinner to plan what music she would play. 

The funny thing was, Lucy hadn’t applied to the festival. Her mom filled out the form and sent in a CD of her playing. “I didn’t want you to be disappointed if you didn’t get in,” her mom said. Lucy thought her mom didn’t want to give her a chance to say no. At that time, Lucy believed it was bad to say no to things. 

The guy from Tokyo leaned in and asked, “Tanglewood?” 

“Yeah.” 

“How old are you?” 

“Fifteen.” 

He looked at Liesel/Louisa, who said, “Wow.” Lucy didn’t mean to show off. It was hard to know when to share her achievements and when to keep quiet. 

“It’s just part of this new youth-spotlight thing they’re trying…” Lucy started to explain, but Liesel/Louisa looked away, as if she saw someone she needed to talk to. The guy from Tokyo stayed and asked, “Have you ever been to Japan?” He had long, messy hair, like many musicians, to show he was a cool music nerd. 

“Once, when I was about eight,” Lucy replied. He was about to say something when Lucy's grandfather came over. 

“Lucy, let me introduce you to someone,” he said, taking her arm and pulling her away. “And don’t get too friendly with the competition.” 

“They’re not the competition,” Lucy said. 

“Everyone is the competition,” her grandfather replied. He took her around the room to meet important people. Lucy smiled and nodded a lot, but she only understood part of what they said. 

In the elevator to their room after the party, her grandfather said, “You did well in there, Lucy. I’m proud of you. This is an important festival, and people are talking about you. They all know who you are.” 

Lucy liked that. She liked being someone important, even if some people were jealous or thought she was too young. Being a concert pianist didn’t make her special at school. Even her best friend, Reyna, didn’t know or care that she could play difficult music. But in places like this, Lucy felt she mattered.
