“Spending too much time online is not good for you. You need to go outside and enjoy the real world,” said Dad. It is hard to argue with him, so I wanted to learn what experts say about this. I found some interesting information. 

Research shows that many teenagers who use social media have real friends, feel like they belong, and are learning important skills for the digital world. Simon Miles, an expert on online safety, says that social media is a big part of growing up today. Teenagers use social media differently than adults. They do not just check emails or buy tickets; they live in it. This is not good or bad; it depends on how you use it.

How is our social media use different from what our parents did when they were young? Jim Matthews, a social media expert, says it is like the youth clubs of the past. Teenagers today use social media to share jokes and talk about their lives, just like parents did when they were younger. It helps teenagers find their identity away from their parents and deal with issues with their friends.

Psychologist Professor Keith Davidson says that being a teenager is a time to ask, “Who am I?” Social media can help with this. You can share your favorite music or sports and see how others think. Research shows that teenagers who use social media are not more self-centered than those who do not. He also says that for shy people, talking online can be easier than in person. It can help them practice social skills in a safe way.

Professor Andrew Phillips studies how young people use social media. He believes it can help quiet people with special interests connect with others. If you are one of the few people in your school who likes a certain type of music, you might feel alone. But if you find a group online with people who like the same music, you can feel more connected and popular in a different way.

Pauline White, an expert in digital education, says that young people can find new interests online and create their own content. She thinks social media is a way for teenagers to be creative. They can make videos, podcasts, and blogs about what they like. Photo-sharing sites help photographers connect, learn new skills, and share their work. This can help them get jobs in the future. 

Every business uses social media to sell products and reach customers. If you have many friends on social media, they can be potential customers for your product. If you connect all your networks, you can reach even more people. 

Teenagers who use social media creatively will benefit when they grow up and start working. Matthews agrees that many sites allow people to work together to create and share content. Working together is an important skill in today’s world and helps you get a job.

When people think of a fun family vacation, they might not think of a long trip across nine western states in the US and one province in Canada. But my parents wanted to have a special summer vacation this year. My dad wanted to plan a family trip that he thought would bring us closer together. He and my mom often said, “Not enough people do this anymore,” while my twin brother and I looked at each other in surprise.

In mid-June, we packed our car with suitcases, food, and clothes for all kinds of weather. I was excited but also worried about losing my privacy for two weeks. With not much space left in the car, we started our big family road trip. We left our big house for smaller places to stay for the next five thousand miles. I wondered what adventures we would have.

We drove west through Oklahoma. Even though we were still close to home, we had some adventures. One night, we stopped near a town in Oklahoma and saw many stars in the sky, but we almost got blown off the road by a dust storm. We learned that cows have the right to cross the road!

The next day, we woke up early and continued our trip. We saw deserts and then mountains. Each day was different, but they all blended together. We left our footprints in the Great Sand Dunes and then went to Pagosa Springs, Colorado. That town smelled strongly of sulfur, which was new for us. 

As we drove up a mountain, we realized that the roads for Jeeps were not for regular cars. We saw a mix of old and new things everywhere we went. We often got stuck in traffic because of construction. We laughed when we saw big “CLOSED” signs at the Four Corners Monument.

On our way to Yellowstone National Park, we saw many wind farms. At Yellowstone, we watched the sun set over areas where bears lived. Sometimes, we had to stop our car to let bears cross the road, which was called a “bear jam.” We had a close encounter with a bear and a worried park ranger, which made for great memories.

As we drove, I forgot about life back home. Even our old hotel, which had no internet or cell phone service, could not ruin our fun. The hotel was 95 years old, but the views were amazing. After watching a rainstorm from our hotel in Canada, we started our trip back home. My parents were right; you don’t need to go far away to find something special.

When we got home, it felt nice to be together again, and I was happy I didn’t fight with my brother during our long trip. We took three thousand photos of our adventures, and I knew I would remember the unexpected moments the most.

Rose Frost was sixteen years old. She was going to live with her grandmother, Daisy. Rose's family was separating for two years. Her father, Jeff, had a job in another country, and her mother, Dahlia, would go with him. Rose and her older sister, Amy, would stay in England. Amy needed to finish her last year of school, so she would live at the college. She was happy because she got the best room with a kitchen and a study area. Amy could also use the Internet and phone for free. Their parents would check on Amy, even if she did not want them to.

Rose was moving to her grandmother’s house. She only remembered a few happy times with Daisy and did not know her grandfather. Daisy wanted Rose to stay with her, even if Rose's parents were not happy about it. There had been a problem between Daisy and Rose's parents, so Rose had not spent time with her grandmother for a long time. Rose was excited to live with Daisy. Her mother said it would be interesting because Daisy liked to meet people. Rose thought she would get dinner invitations, coffee mornings, and shopping trips soon.

Daisy was not a typical old lady. She went to many social events. Before moving, Rose talked with her mother. Rose was sensible and knew about healthy eating and staying fit. But she wanted to be independent. She wanted to play music loud, invite friends over, and go out without asking for permission. She did not want to be told what to do all the time. Daisy understood this.

Rose's mother gave her a new mobile phone for emergencies. Rose was very happy about it. They all agreed to trust each other. Rose would act mature, and Daisy would not be too strict. If they had problems, they would talk about it.

Rose was not a wild child. She had good friends, and her school reports were always good. In five weeks, she would start at a new school and meet new friends. This was her fourth school in five years, so she felt experienced. She knew this would be her last school before finishing. For Rose, it was a new beginning in her life.

Charlotte Grainger talks about how her primary school teacher thought she might write a book one day. Charlotte felt that writing a book was a big challenge, and when she turned 13, she decided to try. Now, her first novel is going to be published. She told her old teacher about it, and the teacher was surprised. The teacher thought Charlotte would write a book when she was older, around 30 or 40 years old. But Charlotte didn’t understand why she should wait to do something she was good at.

It is a winter afternoon, and I am in the office of Charlotte’s publishers. I am going to interview a 15-year-old girl about her book. I was surprised to see a teenager sitting there. The book is a big achievement. It is exciting and well-written. The only thing that shows it was written by a teenager is the age of the main character. A public relations person is with us in case Charlotte needs help, but she does not. Charlotte is confident and smart, but she is also calm and does not act too proud.

Charlotte knows she is young. When I ask her about the important questions in her book, she says, “I was asking big questions, not answering them. I don’t have many life lessons to share.” She laughs and says she is interested in the idea of taking responsibility.

Charlotte thinks that books for teenagers often show three types of characters: the outsider who becomes accepted, the naïve teenager who knows little about the world, and the awkward teenager who struggles socially. She feels annoyed that there are not many stories about normal teenagers. She believes that some writers make teenagers feel like they do not know who they are, which can hurt their confidence.

Charlotte loves reading books by famous fantasy writers, but sometimes these books made her doubt her own writing. She wondered if she needed to write about deep topics to make a good book. However, she found a helpful book called How Not to Write a Novel. This book says that if readers can guess what will happen next, the story is not exciting anymore.

Some people think Charlotte’s parents helped her get her book published because they are both journalists. Her father knew someone in publishing who read her book first. Charlotte knows she is lucky because it is hard for anyone to get a first novel read. She says, “Every writer needs support and a bit of luck, but after that, you have to rely on your own talent. I don’t take anything for granted.”

"‘Remember, speed is your friend, not your enemy,’ said Gareth, our instructor, as we looked down the ski slope. ‘Now, who wants to go first?’ The group looked nervous. Then a guy named David, who had some experience with freestyle ski-jumping, stepped forward. He skied down the slope towards the jump. He went up fast and his arms were in the air. We could see something was wrong. We held our breath. He landed hard, lost both skis, and fell into the snow. ‘Remember,’ Gareth said, ‘speed can be unpredictable.’ 

I thought maybe freestyle skiing was not for me. On my previous skiing trips, I liked to practice turns in the snow. I was not like the teenagers who did tricks on ramps and half pipes. I thought it looked fun, but I was afraid to try because I didn’t know how. My parents decided we would have a winter holiday at a freestyle skiing training center in the US. It had a big indoor area with trampolines and ski jumps with fake snow. Students jumped and tried new tricks, landing in foam cubes. This was not like skiing outside.

After practicing indoors, we went outside to try for real. ‘Progression is inevitable!’ the center’s slogan said. Gareth told us that before places like this, new ski jumpers just went down the slopes without training. He warned us, ‘If you land on the knuckle, you’ll be in trouble.’ The ‘knuckle’ is the flat part behind the jump. If you land there, you stop suddenly, and it hurts. So, speed is important.

At first, I found it hard to ignore my fear and go fast towards the jump. My legs wanted to slow down, and I landed on the knuckle. I didn’t fall, but I felt tired. ‘You need to control the jump, not let it control you,’ said Gareth. 

On the second day, we started on the trampolines. I thought I would hate being inside, but bouncing was fun. Some exercises helped us practice ski-jumping moves, and others helped us know where our bodies were in the air. Gareth told us what to do. I needed to work on my ‘aerial awareness’ because I only noticed the jump before I took off and then I found myself in the foam cubes.

We went back to the mountain to try again. I had some problems, but finally, I landed properly. Gareth was happy, and I felt proud. But that feeling didn’t last long. On my last jump of the day, I tried to keep my speed up. I jumped and landed in the right place. Then I saw both my skis sliding down the slope, no longer on my feet."

Imagine you are on a rollercoaster in an amusement park. You feel scared and hold on tight. The ride stops, and you take a deep breath as the carriage goes slowly up. Then, suddenly, it drops, and your stomach feels funny. You go fast forward, turn left, and even go upside down. You scream because you are scared. But you chose to go to the amusement park, just like many other people do every year.

Amusement parks are very popular and make a lot of money. To make exciting rides, many people work together. There are engineers, designers, and marketing experts who help create these rides. Being a rollercoaster designer sounds fun, but it is a big job. They must make sure the ride is exciting but also safe for everyone. 

Many of the ideas for rollercoasters were created a long time ago by a designer named John Miller. He made rides that were very thrilling, but now there are rules to keep people safe. I talked to some experts about rollercoasters. Professor Brendan Walker, who designs thrilling rides, said it is important to put all the parts together well. Dr. John Roberts explained that the goal is to make people feel like they are being tossed around but still safe.

To make a great ride, the teams think of a fun story, like a space adventure or a jungle chase. They also try to make the ride taller, twistier, and have steeper drops. Professor Walker said that experience and testing are very important in this job. Jeff Hornick, who helps develop theme parks, said it is good to understand what people want and to try the rides before they open.

I asked if new technology, like virtual reality, would change rollercoasters. Walker said that while new technology can be exciting, the real experience of the rollercoaster is still the most important part.

At 25 years old, Miranda Ellington has done a lot as a choreographer. She has created dances for many theatres and dance companies. She also dances sometimes. I wonder why she does both things with her busy life. She says, “Dancing again helps me remember what it is like to be in the studio and follow the orders of choreographers. It can be very tense and frustrating. Choreographers sometimes forget how hard it is to practice all day.”

As a choreographer, Miranda teaches and enjoys working with young students. She says, “New dancers are often open to trying new ideas. Working with students can be easier than with professionals because they are willing to take risks. They want to succeed, but they do not always know their strengths and weaknesses. This makes them open to feedback, even if it is tough. Sometimes they challenge what I say, but I like their honest opinions.”

When Miranda starts with a new group, she focuses on the dance steps, and the music guides her. She says, “There may be music I don’t like, but I still create the best dance routine for it. If dancers do not like a certain music piece, it can be frustrating, but I must find a way to make it work. I wish I could try different pieces of music to make rehearsals more fun. But now, I mostly work on big productions where the music is already chosen.”

Miranda does not want to stay with one place. She believes it is important to meet new people. However, she knows that different theatres and schools have different styles. She must change how she works each time she goes to a new place. This helps her not to get stuck in her ways.

We talk about a recent documentary about ballet dancers and choreographers. Miranda says, “Some documentaries look nice but are not real. This one shows what life is really like in a dance company. There is a scene where a young dancer gets many corrections. I smiled because I understood her struggle. She knows she is not doing it right but cannot make her body do what she needs. It is hard to watch, but it is real. People do not see how much work and dedication ballet takes.”

I ask Miranda what makes a great dance production. She says, “It is when everything comes together – the music, costumes, lighting, and dancers. Perfection is hard to achieve, but aiming high is important. It helps you get away with some mistakes. I have worked on shows where the dance steps are good, but the costumes or props are distracting. That is disappointing.”

Miranda has done many types of work, and I wonder how she sees herself. Is she a modern dance choreographer or a ballet expert? She replies, “People want to label you, but I don’t understand why. There is a trend to focus on one area, but I do not agree with that. Maybe one day I will be known for one thing, but for now, I want to explore more.”

A friend once asked me why I travel when I can watch everything on TV. I said that TV shows many amazing things, but why stay at home when there is so much to see and do outside? This conversation gave me the idea for my fun four-day trip and a film to make people turn off their TVs.

A friend was giving away his old sofa, and I decided to use it in my trip. I added three wheels and some cables to the sofa and used old seatbelts to hold it on my shoulders. I put my bags on the sofa and slept on it every night, even one night on the beach. Some friends came with me to help pull the sofa and cheer me on.

I have walked on many trips before, but this was very different. It was the longest I have ever walked, and I walked on main roads. This meant I could stop at a café and relax on the sofa with a cappuccino instead of sitting on a rock with my sandwiches blowing away in the wind.

I often told people, “No, I’m not doing this for charity, and I’m not training for a marathon.” When someone at work asks about my weekend, I prefer to tell them how I pulled a sofa 100 miles across southern England instead of talking about the latest TV show. You can see the film on my website.

When I read about swimming trips in the sea around some small Greek islands, I was very excited. I had never been on a group trip before. My brother was busy, so I thought a group holiday would be good for me. The man at the Greek port looked surprised when I asked for a ticket for one person because many families go to the islands. I told him I would not be alone for long; I would join ten other people to swim around the small islands. He still looked confused, but he smiled and let me on the boat.

Before we started, our group had sent emails to each other, but we did not have much time to talk before our first swim. Our guides told us that a support boat would be with us the whole time and showed us how to talk to it. We swam a short distance to split us into speed groups, and then it was time for our first long swim of 1.5 km. I was nervous. I had trained in my local pool and swum in rivers, but I had never swum long distances in the open sea.

Soon, the waves got bigger, and I was at the back of the slow group, which was not where I wanted to be. I saw faster swimmers moving ahead like dolphins. I wanted to finish this first swim, and I was very happy when I did it by myself. 

The next days were similar: we jumped in, swam at a comfortable speed, and stopped to look at the beautiful views. As the swims got longer, I swam faster and enjoyed them more. I felt like I did not need the support boat. I can’t wait to come back next year!

Being a flight attendant is not easy, but it is a great job. Since I started, I have traveled to many places, like the US and Australia. I work with amazing people, have a lot of free time, and my job is never boring. This makes it a good job for young people like me!

When I was a child, I went to a boarding school far from my family. I often flew alone when school started and ended. Sometimes, I felt lonely, so I asked the flight attendants if I could help serve meals to the passengers. Some of them let me help. 

Later, when I wanted to change from my banking job, I remembered this. I looked for a new job and went to an interview. There were many young people there, and many of them were also changing careers. Before the interview, I practiced what to say. I talked about my skills and my work experience, not just that I loved to travel. Because of this, I got the job!

I think this job is good for anyone. There are many reasons to like it, but the free flights are not the best part. Most airline workers work very hard. There is a saying: "No one is finished until everyone is finished." It feels like a big family. Even if we don’t see each other all the time, we are still close.

When I am not working, I don’t have to take work home. If I have difficult passengers, which is rare, I know the flight will end soon, and I will probably never see them again!

At the summer camp where I work, I really like to see the children do things they thought they could not do. Most of the children can swim and play table tennis before they come here, but rock climbing is new for many of them. Some children feel nervous, but after we encourage them, they try and all reach the top. This makes them very happy. 

At the start of the week, some children miss their homes. It is not the youngest children who miss home the most; it is usually the ten- to thirteen-year-olds. We do not let them use their mobile phones all the time. We tell them they can call home after lunch. When they ask again after dinner, we say it is too late to call now and they can do it tomorrow. Most children feel better in a few days, and at the end of the week, they come to us and thank us because they had a great time.

Sometimes, it is not just the children who feel lonely. We also have parents who call a lot to ask how their child is. This is not necessary. Often, their child is busy playing games or doing other things, so we tell the parents to call back later.

We often see a certain type of child at camp. They usually wear expensive new clothes. These children often argue when we ask them to change into something more suitable, but soon they understand why.

Text: 'Rock the Planet is a musical show where actors also need to be good musicians. It opened in London last year after being in the USA for five years. In the USA, it won the ‘Best Musical’ award four times! 

Doing the show with all British actors was not easy. In the UK, there are rules about how many shows young actors can do each week. In the USA, they can do more shows. Because of this, they needed twice as many actors in the UK. Luckily, the director found many talented actors in the UK, and they just won their first ‘Best Musical’ award.

The theatre in London is bigger than the one in the USA, and it has been full every night. Many people want to hear the songs that became popular in America. I met Jamie, an 11-year-old actor in the show. He said, ‘It’s great that I get paid to play, especially with a beautiful Gibson guitar.’ 

Jamie told me that the young actors are very busy. ‘We have normal school lessons at the theatre. The teacher is great, but I miss my old school friends,’ he said. I asked him what his friends think of the show. He said, ‘My whole class came! The theatre gives special ticket prices for schools. They loved it, and that made me feel confident. My parents come when they can, but it’s expensive for them.’

When I told Jamie I also play guitar, he found a spare one and invited me to play with him and the other young actors. We played a song called Days, which I didn’t know. Jamie helped me, and I was happy when I finally got it right. I was impressed by Jamie’s skills and wished I could play like him. I was just trying to keep up and was glad the director wasn’t there to hear my mistakes!

The young actors were already musicians, and some played several instruments, but none had played in a band before. They found it easy to play together. Jamie said the hard part was looking natural when they first performed. They were so focused that they forgot to smile!

The show will be in London for another year, and it is worth seeing.'
